loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Jaya, age 31, and her husband, Sona, age 37, with their two children come from the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. They are both uneducated but know how to sign their names. She is a homemaker and her husband is a cycle van puller. Her husband's earnings are insufficient for their family, because the cycle van which he pulls is a rented one. To earn more income for their family, they both made a plan to purchase their own cycle van but due to insufficient money they couldn’t. So Jaya decided to take out a loan and purchase a van for her husband, so that her husband can easily earn more income and doesn’t have to pay any rent. They hope this business can be profitable for them because people use a van for traveling purposes and also for carrying goods.

Jaya's dream is to make her family financially strong with earnings from the business.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods.

loans.name: Lobriter

texts.en: Lobriter is 20 years old and lives in the West Point which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and a high school graduate. Notwithstanding she manages her business well to enable her get some money for her personal use. Over the past six years she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problem. This business started with a little amount she got from her boyfriend. She works six days in every week, spending 8 hours with her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, tissue, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, tissue, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Abdiwahab Abdoo

texts.en: Abdiwahab Abdoo is 27 years old. He studies at New Generation University College, in the faculty of Human Resource Management. He faces a major problem in his learning. His problem is the lack of a laptop to learn. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. He cannot pay the money all at one time. He requested a loan from Kaaba MFI, and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. After university, Abdiwahab hopes to study a Masters Program in Development studies.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: İsa

texts.en: İsa is 53 years old, married, has three children and lives with his wife, son and his son's bride. Already 20 years they are Internally Displaced Persons from Füzuli city and now live in Boyuk Bahmanli village of Füzuli region. İsa's son is married and he is a taxi driver at the same village. İsa has been in the sheep-breeding business at their homestead yard for many years. He buys little lambs, raising them and sells them to a butcher to earn money. Also he periodically sells wool of sheep. In Azerbaijan, sheep meat is used more and more. Various national dishes are prepared from sheep meat, like “dolma,” “küftə,” “bozbash,” etc. Today İsa needs 2300 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason he applied to the Kiva organization's partner company, Komak, for a loan. He plans on the loan to supply for winter and wants to buy enough hay for sheep, vaccinate them, etc. Isa is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future he wants to open a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy enough hay.

loans.name: Godja

texts.en: Godja is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents in Fuzuli region. Twenty years ago his motherland, Fuzuli city, was occupied by Armenian occupants. Today his family are Internally Displaced Persons(IDP). Godja’s mother is a housewife, his father is a seller and Godja is a taxi driver. Winter is coming and he needs a loan amount of 1100 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy a new wheel and anti-crash chain. Therefore he applied to Komak company. Godja is very thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future he wants to buy a bus and wants to be a bus driver. In his personal life, Godja wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel and anti-crash chain

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is 55 years old, married and has three children. He lives with his family in Fuzuli region and has a butcher shop.  Already for 20 years, he and his family have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land. 

Vidadi applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 1800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to repair the roof of his butcher shop. It should be noted that, this is his third loan. Previously, Vidadi borrowed 1200 AZN and 2000 AZN, then successfully paid them off. 

Vidadi is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future, he wants to increase the area of his shop.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his butcher shop

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 30-year-old married father of two children who has been working as a barber since nineteen years ago. He is a hard worker who started working at an early age, when he was supposed to quit school during his elementary class to help in supporting his family in covering their needs.

Jihad is a hardworker who puts so much effort in developing his business to make sure that it has a good enough income to cover his increasing family's needs.  Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva to get the requested cash to buy necessary facial treatments and men's beauty creams to increase his business income through selling these items to his current and expected clients.  He hopes to keep on being capable of developing his business and replying to his family's needs.

loans.use: buy supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Oscar Guadalupe

texts.es: Oscar de 40 años de edad habita en  condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa desde hace 8 años. Oscar trabaja como vigilante en una colonia cerca de su localidad desde hace 10 años y de esa forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy sencillas y desea hacer algunas mejoras para dar a su familia mayor seguridad. Ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina Duralita para reparar y cambiar la cubierta del techo, mandar hacer e instalar una puerta y una ventana ya que las existentes están en muy mal estado.
texts.en: Oscar is 40 years old and he and his wife have lived under very humble conditions for eight years.  Oscar works as a guard in a neighborhood near his and has done so for 10 years.  He earns a living and supports his household this way.  His living conditions are simple and he wants to make some improvements for his family and provide them better security.  He is asking for a loan through FUSAI so he can buy Duralita metal to repair and replace the roof, and have a door and window made, because the current ones are in bad shape.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Santos Del Rosario

texts.es: Santos de 33 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 11 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es que su familia tenga buenas condiciones de vida. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos de forma ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Gracias a que es una mujer amable, honesta y responsable se ha ganado la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Con el fin de cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar sus ventas e ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mariscos como: camarones, pescado de Curvina y Robalo. Confía que con esta inversión logrará su objetivo de incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 33 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner and their young daughter, who is eleven years old. The most important thing to her is that her family have good living standards. She has been selling seafood as a street vendor in different areas of her town for six years. Since she is a kind, honest, and responsible woman, she has gained the trust of many customers, who prefer her more and more. 

In order to meet a higher demand, which would allow her to increase her sales and her income, she decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing larger quantities of seafood like shrimp, croaker fish, and sea bass. She is confident that this investment will allow her to achieve her goal of increasing sales and earnings, which in turn will allow her to provide her family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy seafood like shrimp, croaker fish, and sea bass.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija de un años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, ella se dedica la venta de antojitos como: yuca frita, tostadas de plátano y papas, etc. desde hace 2 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir algunos gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como: yuca, papas, plátanos, aceite, etc. y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This woman lives in a house of her own with her life partner and a two-year-old daughter. She is a young and hard-working woman.  She sells snacks such as fried cassava, French fries, fried plantain, etc. Two years ago she opened her business at home. With what she earns and with the help of her husband, it is possible for them to cover some of the home expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients she needs: cassava, potatoes, plantain, oil, etc. and in that way improve her profits and reach financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cassava, potatoes, plantain, oil, etc.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es: Willian de 27 años de edad es casado y tiene una hija de 16 meses de edad. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su querida familia y con mucho esfuerzo van saliendo adelante. William se dedica a la agricultura y a la vez junto a su esposa han logrado abrir una venta de tortillas y antojitos típicos. Ambos se preocupan por dar a su hija mejores condiciones de vida por lo que se esfuerzan día con día por salir adelante. Con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra la materia prima como: maíz, cal, verduras, aceite, carne, yuca, etc. Para la preparación de las deliciosas tortillas y variedad de antojitos típicos.
texts.en:
Willian is 27 years old and is married with a 16-month daughter. He lives in very basic conditions with his beloved family and they manage to get on in life with a great deal of effort. Willian works in agriculture and at the same time he and his wife have managed to open a place selling tortillas and typical snacks. They are both keen to give their daughter better living conditions and so they strive every day to make progress in life. 

In order to grow his business Willian is asking for this loan from FUSAI to spend on raw ingredients such as corn, lime powder, vegetables, oil, meat, yucca etc. for preparing the delicious tortillas and a variety of typical snacks.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, vegetables, oil, meat, yucca etc. to prepare tortillas and a variety of typical snacks.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 23 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de un año y medio. Miguel es jornalero y vendedor de cocos, de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Miguel no cuenta con agua potable en su hogar por lo que desea construir un pozo dentro de su terreno ya que por la zona donde habita el agua se encuentra a pocos metros de profundidad. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava para construir el pozo lo antes posible y así facilitar la obtención y el almacenamiento del vital líquido.
texts.en: Miguel is 23 and lives in very humble conditions with his partner and their 18-month-old daughter. Miguel works as a day laborer and sells coconuts so that he can earn a living and meet his household expenses. The family's home does not have running water, so Miguel wants to dig a well on his land as there is water just a few meters underground in the area where he lives. Miguel is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI [Fundación Salvadoreña de Apoyo Integral - Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development] to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to build a well as soon as possible and ensure a supply and storage of the essential fluid, water.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to build a well.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is a 48-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father to one son. Issa works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income. He has a lot of monthly obligations and his salary is not enough. so he decided to work an extra job. Issa would like to buy a small rickshaw to transfer goods for the local traders. The income he will get for this job will help him pay for the family expenses. Issa took a USD Murabaha (shariah compliant) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods to local traders. By taking this loan, Issa and his family's living conditions will be improved. Issa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods to local traders

loans.name: Gilmar Bladimir

texts.es: Gilmar de 42 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 16 años y 3 años de edad. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la pesca desde hace 14 años y de esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones de las paredes de la cocina ya que actualmente se encuentran deterioradas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir la compra de cemento y pago de mano de obra para repellar las paredes de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: Gilmar is 42 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and two daughters who are 16 and 3.  He makes a living in agriculture and fishing; this is how he has provided the household expenses for the past 14 years.  Gilmar desires to improve the condition of the kitchen walls which are currently deteriorating.  Therefore he seeks this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement and labor to plaster the kitchen walls of his home.

loans.use: to purchase cement and to pay the labor to plaster the walls of the kitchen in his home.

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob lives in the village of Goravan, which is in Ararat region. He is married and has two sons. 

Serob lives with his parents in a very nice house. His family lives by the help of his and his father’s hard work.  His father is a farmer and he mainly cultivates and sells onions. Serob himself has his own business.  He has a small building of his own and he makes fast food. Since it is located in a very central part of his village many people visit his eatery during the day. As Serob says, once his eatery used to be the only place where people came to eat something and just to have a rest for several minutes, but now in this field he is not alone. There are already several eateries opened and now there exists  a kind of rivalry among them.

Serob asked for a loan in the amount of USD 800 in order to repair his eatery to make it more comfortable and more attractive for his customers.

loans.use: repair his eatery

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik once liked the deal with Kiva lenders and for the second time he wants to take a loan. He lives in the village Getahovit which is in the Tavush region. His two sons are already grown up and the elder is fulfilling his military service with the army. As Gagik used to, he is still doing cargo transfers; he has a truck that he uses to carry cargo for individual and contract orders, but farming and agriculture still brings the main part of income for his family. In his nice farm he has six cows, two calves, five piglets, twenty chickens and large nice orchard. Gagik sells very tasty cheese made of his own, milk, meat and different dairy products and also fruits from his garden. All these are results of Gagik’s and his wife’s devoted work with great hope, this time to have more profit than the previous time.
For his second loan Gagik asks a loan of 1.100.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a cow, two bulls, several piglets and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a cow, two bulls, several piglets and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Eliel

texts.en:
Eliel is 50 years old.  He is married to a farmer and they have four children. With this loan, he would like to use to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer for  maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming Eliel wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 53 years old. He is married and has five children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, who all go to school. She would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a youth client from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has a child.  Haydar is the only provider for his family. 

Haydar is a barber. After previously working for a few years as an employee at a barber shop, Haydar established his own business in 2007 and has been gradually gaining much experience in this field. Now, Haydar has 2 hired employees and is well-known in his surrounding area. 

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop, install a display window and a sign for his barber shop. In the future, Haydar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to open a bigger barber shop and attract more customers and thus provide more income for his family.

loans.use: renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, tiene la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio en esta ocasión lo hara en el cultivo de maíz, por lo que opta por otro crédito con el que comprara semilla, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y plaguicidas, con lo que tendrá una cosecha más abundante, mejores ganancias y clientes complacidos.
Con el crédito anterior su economía mejoro, la granja de pollos aumento su producción  y les da una alimentación mucho mejor a su familia, sigue trabajando para que su negocio sea más amplio.
texts.en:
Tereso needs to invest in his corn growing business, so he has decided to apply for a new loan. He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide. He will then have a more abundant harvest, better earnings, and satisfied clients.

With his previous loan, Tereso improved his financial circumstances and was able to offer better nutrition to his family. He is still working to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicide.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar otro crédito para surtir su negocio comprar carnes, aceite, maíz, leña, gas, con esto tendrá materia prima para preprar la comidaque ofree a asus clientes y seguir trabajando  , sus ingresos aumentaran para cubrir los gastos de hogar y cancelar las cuotas.
Con el préstamo anterior amplio su negocio, pudo cancelar puntual sus cuotas, mantuvo la fidelidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María needs to request another loan to restock her business with meats, oil, corn, firewood, and gas. With this she will have raw materials to prepare the food that she sells to her clients, and continue working. Her increased income will cover household expenses and pay off fees.

With the previous loan she expanded her business, punctually made her repayments, and maintained the loyalty of her clients.

loans.use: to buy meats, oil, corn, firewood, and gas

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yesenia, necesita comprar bebidas, carnes, embutidos, arroz, golosinas, etc., para que el inventario de su chalet esté bien surtido y también tendrá lo necesario para preparar la comida que ofrece a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a tener un negocio más competitivo para obtener los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en: Yesenia needs a loan to buy drinks, meat, sausages, rice, sweets, etc. so that her cafe is well stocked. Then she will have the ingredients on hand to prepare meals for her clients. The last loan helped her make her business more competitive which allowed her to make the revenues needed to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy sodas, meat, sausage, rice, and candy, etc

loans.name: Didma Cristina

texts.es:
Didma, es una señora viuda, que luego que su esposo falleció ella ha tenido que asumir toda la responsabilidad de su familia, actualmente vive con dos de sus hijos, comenta que desde que estaba muy joven se dedico a la crianza y destazo de ganado, es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres. En todo el tiempo que tiene de practicarla no ha tenido ningún problema que le signifique dejar de ejercerla.
Comprara ganado para criarlo y luego destazarlo, le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio, aumentar sus ventas cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, mejorar su economía, también espera cancelar muy bien el crédito.
Aspira cambiar sus condiciones familiares y tener un negocio más amplio
texts.en:
Didma is a widow who has had to take full responsibility for her family after her husband died. She currently lives with two of her children. She says that she has been engaged in breeding and cutting up cattle since she was very young, an activity she has learned from her parents; and in all the years she has been engaged in this activity she has never had problems that would lead her to stop this type of activity.
She will buy cattle to breed it and to then cut it up; this will help her consolidate her activity, increase her sales, meet her customers’ requests and improve her economic situation; she also hopes to repay the loan according to schedule.
She aims to change her family conditions and to expand her activity.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a student. She studies at the local university and specializes in the department of Public Management. Elina lives together with her parents (her father is in the photo), grandmother and little sister. She studies hard to be able to complete her education and become a good specialist. Her parents are perfectly managing to cover family's basic needs, but it is very difficult for them save money for Elina's education. She has applied for this loan to help. The loan will give her an opportunity to pay for university tuition and continue studies at university.
Elina hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Orvelicia

texts.es:
Orvelicia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora y madre de 4 hijos los cuales el mayor dese encuentra en hogar a parte, los dos que le siguen estudian en secundaria en diferentes grados y el ultimo en la primaria. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo cursar con mucho sacrificio y mucho esfuerzo gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. Su familia por muchas generaciones se ha dedicado a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café y en su generación no es la excepción ya que en la zona donde ella habita es muy apta para cultivar y producir por su tierra y su clima agradable para el producto. Ella también se dedica a otras actividades como ser la cría de cerdos y gallinas para la venta desde hace 10 años como también tiene un pequeña pulperia buscando siempre como generar y aportar en la economía de su hogar. El terreno que ella y su esposo cultivan lo adquirió mediante una compra el cual está ubicado a 5 minutas de su casa de habitación en el cual solo ella y su esposo se involucran trasladándose a pie diariamente.
Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos por medio de la compra de abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos que aseguraran y mejoraran su cultivo y producción de café.
Sus planes so poder seguir aumentando sus cultivos ya que la tierra es propicia para esta clase de producto y podría sembrar una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, de esa manera poder generar ingresos para su familia y sus hijos y poder educarlos a nivel universitario.
texts.en:
Orvelicia is a 36 year old woman. She is a fighter and an entrepreneur. She has four children. The oldest stays in her house part-time, two study in different grades in secondary school and one is in primary school. Orvelicia has a degree in Primary Education which she completed with great effort and sacrifice and the support of her parents.

For many generations her family has been involved in agriculture, more specifically in growing coffee. Her generation is no exception. The area in which she lives is very suitable for coffee production as the soil and climate are perfect for this product. She has also raised pigs and chicken commercially for the past ten years as well as running a small store. She is always looking for ways to generate revenue and support the household.

The land that her and her husband work was bought by them. It is five minutes from their house so they walk back and forth daily.

Today Orvelicia is requesting a loan to protect and maintain her crops by buying fertilizer, manure and other supplies that protect and improve her crop and production of coffee. Her plans are to expand her plantings as the land will support this kind of production and plant a greater variety of product to be able to offer to her clients. In this way she can generate income for her family and educate her children through to university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Bardiss Group

texts.en: The Bardiss group consists of four females from Hodeidah, Yemen. Bards is a 29-year-old single woman. She works hard in providing the family. She has started her job creating homemade henna items, like mixing perfumes and creams which are used by brides for their wedding. She sells it to retailers, customers and door to door. Any shortages of her product items will cause her job to stop. That is why she has applied for a loan to buy the required henna items to continue her business. All members of the group are hoping to earn a good income, which will allow them to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the required henna items to continue her business.

loans.name: Mohamed Aden

texts.en: Mohamed Aden is a 23-year-old single man. He studies Information Technology at Alpha University College. His problem is that he has no laptop, and it’s difficult for him to have practical practices. He has been informed of Kaaba-Kiva Murabaha's youth laptop loan product.  He would like to have a laptop as loan. He requested a laptop from Kaaba and now he is waiting for the laptop.  Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan and Mohamed will pay monthly repayments. After university Mohamed hopes to work as database developer.

loans.use: buy a laptop for college

loans.name: Kohinur

texts.en:
Kohinur is 43 years old and a married lady. Her husband Safiyar is 51 years old. They have four children (two sons and two daughters). Kohinur's sons are associated with small business and her daughters are getting their higher education. They are from the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. They have their own land, and her husband cultivates different seasonal vegetables in that land. In this winter season they plan to cultivate eggplant and for that Kohinur needs to purchase seeds and fertilizers so she applied for a loan. It is a profitable business for them as her husband is already associated with this work. 

Kohinur is a hardworking woman. She wants to improve her family's financial condition after earning good profit from this business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for cultivating eggplant.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a married woman of 26 years.  She is living with her husband, Jadav, and three children in Katalbari in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district. Her husband is 35 years old and his occupation is farming. Their children are engaged in education. Malati studied up to class VII and Jadav up to class V.

Their main source of income is growing bitter-melon so they want to take proper care of their agricultural activities for growing bitter-melon. In spite of having a small plot of land, they have a keen interest to cultivate karala correctly so they applied for a loan from BJS to invest in farming as well as for more education for their children. They are now not capable of living their life smoothly and are facing many problems due to their low income.

Malati has a kacha house made of mud and straw which is not stable for them due to natural calamities (flood, tsunami, earthquake, etc.) She will be highly obliged if BJS grants this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing bitter-melon (karala).

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 26 years old. She is a hard-working woman from a remote region of Bagnan in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Bipul, and their only son. Her husband, Bipul, is 30 years old. Bina received education up to Class VII (Grade 7) and Bipul up to  Class VI (Grade 6). They live in their small kachha house (made of mud and straw) .Their son is below school-going age.

Bina's husband is a mason by trade. He is the only earning member of the family. But it is a competitive market; his earnings are not enough to provide sustenance.

Bina decided to give financial assistance to her husband and her family by cultivating bananas in their own land. She applied for a loan from BJS. With this loan she wants to buy banana saplings and good quality fertilizers. She has chosen this business as there is a good demand for bananas in their locality and in the present market.

In the future she wants to develop her business and earn more profit. Her dreams are to provide higher education to her son and to meet the expenses of their family with the profits from her business.  Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase good quality banana saplings for cultivating bananas.

loans.name: Manyatta B Group

texts.en:
Manyatta B is a Nuru International group of three farmers in Kuria West District. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Manyatta B collectively guarantee the loan.
Emmanuel (raising his hand) is a representative of the group. He is 24 years old and is married. The loan from Kiva will enable him purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds which he hopes will increase his yield. He will grow maize, sorghum and millet which will definitely improve food security in his household. Emmanuel just like other members of his group will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. He plans to sell the surplus and purchase building materials for the family house.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Mafanikio is a Nuru International group of two farmers in Kuria West district. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Mafanikio collectively guarantee the loan.

Bhoke, who is 45 years old, has been a member of the group for 3 years now. He is married with children.  For the 2014 long rains season, he plans to grow maize, sorghum and millet on ½ an acre and ¼ each, respectively. He is therefore requesting a loan from KIVA to enable him purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer. He is optimistic of getting enough food for his family as well sell the surplus and invest the money in a business.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: María de 55 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hijo y sobrino quienes son mayores de edad y le colaboran con la economía del hogar. María habita en condiciones muy humildes y trabaja muy duro para ganarse el pan de cada día y mantener la economía del hogar. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de ricas tortillas(preparación alimenticia preparada a base se masa de maíz). Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de maíz, gas propano, etc. para aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: María is 55 years old. She lives in her own house with her son and nephew who are both adults and contribute to the household expenses. María lives in very modest conditions and works hard to earn her daily bread and maintain her household. She makes tasty tortillas (a flat bread made from corn dough). This business is her main source of income and she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of corn and propane to increase her sales and her revenues.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina  es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación a sus 38 años de edad es propietaria de una fotoestudio y siendo una mujer divorciada considera que ese no es un obstáculo para sacar adelante a sus hijos; un joven que estudia bachillerato a sus 15 años de edad y un menor que se encuentra estudiando su nivel primario  a nivel del tercer grado y su edad es de 9 años. El nivel académico de la señora es bachillerato, ella aprendió sobre el negocio de la fotografía en su largo tiempo, trabajando en una Foto Estudio en la ciudad. Luego ella se hizo de su propio negocio y se hizo independiente.


Reina, posee mas de 14 años de experiencia en el negocio de las fotografías; debido a que ella primero  trabajo, ese trabajo le permitió conocer a profundidad como manejar un negocio de este tipo, conocer proveedores, atención al cliente, etc. Motivada por la rentabilidad del negocio y con el apoyo de un crédito, ella logro implementar su propio negocio y convertirse en una negociante independiente. En dicho negocio la señora cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y su hijo mayor quienes le apoyan en sus tiempos libres o cuando la demanda lo requiere.

El Crédito otorgado será utilizado para realizar una remodelación en el local, donde esta ubicado el negocio, ella manifiesta que necesita hacer algunos cambios y mejorar la presentación de su negocio y de igual manera comprar algunos materiales o equipos básicos para mejorar sus servicios de fotografías. El objetivo principal es, mejorar la vista de su negocio y así atraer a mas clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, mejorando así las condiciones de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos en sus desarrollo académico y profesional.

Las metas que como familia tienen para un futuro es, apoyar a sus hijos mediante la educación y que sean unos profesionales, ademas que el negocio de fotografías sea cada día mas competitivo, rentable y este adecuadamente equipado para ofrecer los mejores servicios en lo relacionado a fotografías. Con el apoyo de Fundación Campo, espera hacer este sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Reina at 38 is a hard-working woman who desires to get ahead. She owns a photo studio. Being a divorcee does not feel like an obstacle to her in raising her children. One is 15 and is in Secondary school and the other is 9 years old and is in Grade 3. She graduated from Secondary school. She learned about the photography business in her many years working in a photo studio in the city. Then she opened her own studio to work for herself.
 
Reina has more than 14 years in the photography industry. Her work has allowed her to understand in depth how to manage a business of this type, know the suppliers, and how to pay attention to her clients. Motivated by the profitability of this business and with the help of a loan she she managed to open her own business and become a entrepreneur. She has the help of her sister and her older brother and her eldest son who help in their spare time or when there is a lot of demand. 

The loan will be used to remodel the shop. She states that there needs to be some changes and some improvements made to the shop's appearance and also buy some basic equipment and materials to improve her photographic services. The main objective is to improve the appearance of the shop to attract more clients, increase her revenues and improve the living conditions for her family. She wants to also help her children's academic and professional development. She also wants her business to become more competitive and profitable every day, and be properly equipped to offer the best photographic services to her customers. With the assistance of Fundación Campo she hopes to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to remodel her business space to improve it's appearance and buy some basic equipment and material for her photograph service.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Geraldine requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Geraldine has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling electronic mobile load. Helen is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, hotdogs, etc. for her food vending business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, and hotdogs for her food vending business

loans.name: Banco Mujer Forjando Sueños Y Metas Group

texts.es: Este grupo siempre ha presentado una excelente conducta de pago, han logrado aumentar sus ahorros y si alguna tiene alguna emergencia puede solicitar dinero prestado al grupo y devolverlo un mes después con intereses. Muchas han cambiado su actividad productiva ya que la zona donde viven no les permiten tener animales para engorde, a pesar de esto lograron continuar con el comercio y actualmente les va muy bien reciben buenas ganancias. Por lo que desean invertir en la compra de maquillaje, ropa y joyas de catálogos, en cerdos de engorde, ganado y abarrotes para la pulpería. Ya que sus clientes solicitan mucha mercadería.  Actualmente no están las integrantes que iniciaron el grupo pero las cinco que quedan son las correctas para continuar funcionando, son todas muy trabajadoras y con ganas de continuar en lo propio; ya que viven en una de las zonas rurales de San Jose donde no hay suficientes fuentes de empleo. Eligen Fundación Mujer ya que ninguna otra financiera puede prestarles para las actividades de ellas, además les gusta el seguimiento que se les brinda con el crédito.
texts.en:
This group has always presented an excellent conduct in terms of loan repayment, they have managed to increase their savings and if one of the members were to have an emergency, they could request money from the group and repay it a month later with interest. A lot of them have changed their activity as the area in which they live they are unable to have animals to fatten up. Despite this, they manage to continue in sales and it is currently going very well and they are making good profits. The plan to invest in the purchase of make-up, clothing and jewelry catalogs, pigs, and grocery supplies for a store.   

The members who founded the group are not currently involved, but the five who remain are the right ones to continue operating it. They are all very hardworking and with a desire to keep working in their own businesses as they live in one of the rural areas of San José where there are not enough employment opportunities.

They chose Fundación Mujer as no other financier can lend them money for their activities, in addition, they like the follow-up that they get with the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo instead.

Ola is a 20-year-old married woman from Dier Al-Balah.  She is a mother of two small sons.  Ola's hsuband works as an employee with a very low income. For the past two years, Ola's husband has been working in a barber shop that he owns. It is a good project and he has a good experience.

Ola took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to develop his barber shop by buying new tools and beauty products he often uses  in his work. This will improve her barber shop and the family income will increase

loans.use: buy barber tools and products

loans.name: Rafayil

texts.en:
Rafayil is a 34-year-old man.  He has lovely family: wife and son.  His wife is a housewife and helps him in his business.  His son goes to the seventh class in school.  Rafayil's family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in Dovlatyarli village in the Fuzuli region. 

Rafayil has been in the animal breeding business. He buys young calves, raises them and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. Winter is coming and he wants to prepare for winter. Therefore he is requesting for a loan amount of 2100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for buy chaff, hay and straw for his cows. 

Rafayil is thankful to Komak and  Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to start producing dairy products and selling them.

loans.use: to chaff, hay, straw for his cattle

loans.name: Grettel

texts.es:
Grettel tiene 43 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto año del colegio, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad, uno está en la escuela y el mayor en el colegio. Llegó a Fundación Mujer por referencia de una clienta Elia Ruiz, quien tiene una panadería y ha trabajado con esta institución desde el año 2004.
Grettel  está solicitando su cuarto crédito y ha tenido una excelente conducta de pago.
La clienta se dedica al comercio de ropa de hombre, mujer y niño desde hace más de 10 años, ella trabaja con su esposo quien se dedica también al comercio, su herramienta principal es el vehículo, el cual utilizan para el transporte de mercadería y el cobro.
Entre sus labores diarias esta la visita a sus clientes, recoger pedidos y atender las labores del hogar. Una de sus metas es realizarse como comerciante y poner un local en la zona céntrica de Puntarenas, cuidad de la costa pacífica de Costa Rica, donde ella reside.
El beneficio con el crédito sería enorme, ya que va a adquirir mercadería para la temporada de verano, que es una época importante para el comercio en la zona costera de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Grettel is 43 years old. She studied until her fourth year of high school. She lives with her husband and 2 young children. One is in primary school and the older is in high school. She came to Fundación Mujer, or Woman Foundation, by reference of Elia Ruiz, who has a bakery and has worked with this institution since 2004. Grettel is requesting her fourth loan and has had an excellent payment record.
The member has sold men's, women's and children's clothing for a living for more than 10 years. She works with her husband who is also in commerce. His principal tool is his vehicle, which they utilize to transport the merchandise and for collection.
Among her daily tasks is the visiting of customers, taking orders and attending to the household work. One of her goals is to become a merchandizer and have a store in the central zone of Puntarenas, a city on the Pacific coast of Costa Rica, where she lives.
The benefit of the loan would be enormous, as she will acquire merchandise for the summer season, which is an import season for commerce in the costal region of Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, men's, women's and children's clothes

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Abbas is the only provider for the family.

Abbas owns a garage where he specializes in fixing the damaged body parts of a vehicle. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained experience through previously working as an employee for several years at a similar garage. Abbas has good experience in this field and is well-known in the neighborhood since he is the only person with such a profession in the surrounding areas.

Abbas is requesting a loan of $1,800. He will use this loan to buy a piece of specialized equipment for his work. Abbas is aiming to continue providing his family with better standards by improving the quality of his work and increasing his profits.

loans.use: buy auto repair equipment

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old. He is a father of five children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rodi

texts.en: Rodi is a 38-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is involved in a transport business and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children.  He also does brick laying in order to raise more money to support his family.  High cost of fuel and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business dreams, and his desire is buy a lorry since it has high rate of return.  Rodi intends to use this loan to complete his payment of the lorry.

loans.use: buy a lorry

loans.name: Herbert Ernesto

texts.es:
Herbert de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, creció junto a su abuela. Esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja como comerciante. Tienen un hijo, su edad son 7 años y asiste a la escuela. Vive con sus suegros, pero ellos no dependen de él.

Herbert tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio de comercio, ya que desde que dejo la escuela,su abuela le elaboraba tamales, para que los saliera a vender a los alrededores de su vivienda. Luego su abuela consiguió obtener un local en el mercado y Herbert ya no solo se encargaba de ayudarla a vender tamales, sino quetenia a su cargo también, vender frutas y verduras. Así fue como él, aprendió la actividad del comercio, gracias a su abuela.

 Ahora tiene ocho años de estar acompañado y su esposa es también comerciante, desde entonces trabajan junto con su esposa, pero ahora el negocio es venta de ropa para todo tipo. Ellos viven a 10 km de la playa y viajan los días viernes, sábado y domingo a comercializar la ropa de playa, llinas y flotadores, etc. Los otros días venden en la ciudad donde viven. Su horario de trabajo empieza a las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde.

Herbert necesita del préstamo, para invertir mas en el negocio de ropa, ya que esta próxima la temporada navideña y es necesario que posea mas variedad de diseños, para ofrecer a los clientes. De esta forma, se estará contribuyendo a que Herbert pueda tener mas opciones de productos para la venta. 

El sueño principal de Herbert, es tener un terreno propio donde construir su casa, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, la cual podrá ofrecérselas, solo si continua trabajando fuertemente como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.

 Para esto invertirá parte de las ganancias  para cancelar el préstamo, otra parte para continuar con el negocio y por ultimo ahorrar para cumplir el sueño de tener casa propia. Ademas, le dará todo el apoyo a su hijo para que estudie y se prepare academicamente.
texts.en:
Herbert is 27 years old. He studied until seventh grade and was raised by his grandmother. He lives with his partner and she works in commerce. They have a son who his 7 years old and attends school. He lives with his in-laws, but they don’t depend on him economically.

Herbert has a lot of experience in the business of commerce. Since he left school, his grandmother made tamales for him that he sold in the areas near his house. His grandmother later got a store in the market and Herbert no longer just sold tamales; rather, he was also in charge of selling fruits and vegetables. This is how he learned the business of commerce, thanks to his grandmother.

He has now been married for eight years and his wife is also in commerce. He has been working with his wife since they got together, but now the business sells clothing of all kinds. They live 10 kilometers from the beach and they go on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays to sell beach clothes, sandals, floatation devices, etc. On other days they sell where they live. Their work schedule is from 6:30 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon.

Herbert needs the loan to invest in the clothing business because for this next Christmas season he needs to have more variety of designs to offer customers. In this way, you will be contributing to Herbert’s ability to have more product options for sale.

Herbert’s biggest dream is to have his own land where he can build his house so he can provide his family a better quality of life, which he will be able to offer them if he continues working hard like he has always done.

He will invest part of his income to repay the loan. He will use another part to continue the business and he will also save so he can achieve his dream of having his own house. Also, he will give his son all of his support so that he can study and prepare himself academically.

loans.use: to invest more in his clothing business.

loans.name: Amira Ahmed

texts.en: Amira Ahmed is a 28-year-old  girl. She studies Human Resource Management at Alpha University College. Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to prepare her university assignments. She has been informed of Kaaba-Kiva's laptop loans, and she would like to have a laptop as loan. She requested from Kaaba MFI a laptop as a loan and then Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments. Now she is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan and Amira will pay in monthly repayments.

loans.use: buy a laptop for college

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is 24 years old, single, and has no children. He is a youth from Iraq who lives with his family composed of 6 members, of whom 3 are employed. 

Haydar owns a small cafe where people come to relax, drink coffee and other homemade drinks. He has been in this field for more than 3 years and established his own business in 2011. Haydar has a hired employee and has gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area and is well-known in his neighborhood. 

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of USD 3,000,  which he will use to renovate his café and install a sign.  Haydar is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he can provide himself a good career and a bright future

loans.use: to renovate his café and to install signage

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is an Iraqi youth client who is 23-years-old, single and lives with his family of 7 members, of whom 3 are employed and share the family income together.

Hasan owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008. He has built up good experience in this field and is becoming well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. 

Hasan is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a youth loan in order to buy two new refrigerators, 2 new freezers and to install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: by 2 refrigerators, 2 freezers and a rolling shutter for his store

loans.name: Kelin Yolivet

texts.es:
Kelin es una joven de 29 años con un grado de estudio secundaria completa graduándose como enfermera auxiliar madre de 3 hijos quienes estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Junto a su esposo quien es maestro de educación primaria se dedican a la caficultura desde muy temprana edad por ambas partes ya que sus familias son agricultoras por vocación y tradición. Desde hace tres años lo ejercen de manera propia en un terreno que fue heredado por sus padres ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando.
Los planes para el futuro es optar a una plaza en el área de salud y de esa forma poder ejercer su carrera profesionalmente. Su sueño mediante los ingresos generados por sus cultivos de café poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, lograr completar la educación de sus hijos a nivel universitario al igual que la de ella. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café que incluye: fertilización, recolección, limpieza y mano de obra. Con este financiamiento ella espera mejorar sus cultivos y generar mayores ingresos para seguir invirtiendo en la ampliación de su tierra y poder heredarla a sus hijos como un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Kelin is 29 years old. She completed her secondary school degree as an assistant nurse. Her husband is an elementary school teacher, and she has three children in different grades of elementary school. Both she and her husband have worked growing coffee since they were very young, and both of their families have worked in agriculture both by tradition and because they enjoy it. For three years now, Kelin and her husband have grown their own coffee on a plot of land that they inherited from their parents, which is near their home and to which they can walk.

Kelin plans to apply for a position in healthcare so that she can use her degree professionally. Her dream is to use the income she earns from cultivating coffee to improve her family’s quality of life, and to give her children a university education.

Kelin is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and to maintain her coffee fields, including fertilization, harvest and cleaning as well as paying for labor. With this loan she hopes to improve her crops and her income. She would like to continue investing in her land and leave it to her children as a family inheritance.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to maintain her coffee fields, including fertilization, harvest and cleaning as well as paying for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 21 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia pero no poseen luz eléctrica, el trabaja en una moto taxi desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside no poseen luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica que es la que muestra en la fotografia, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: The client is 21 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in their own house. It does not have electricity. He has worked driving a motorcycle taxi for several years. With what he earns he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp as the community in which he lives has no electricity.  He does not have enough money to purchase the lamp. The lamp is a charging station with the solar panels forming the lamp, as you can see in the photograph. It was designed to serve rural homes that do not have electric services. He can benefit his family with this purchase as they will have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, hija  y su grupo familiar. Ella se dedica a la vena de variedad de productos de acuerdo a la temporada de forma ambulante. Desea invertir en la compra de productos navideños los cuales son muy demandados en la época. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de adornos navideños, arbolitos, etc. Ya que de esta forma se gana la vida y tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día prefieren más.
texts.en: Ana is 22 years old. She lives in her own home along with her husband, daughter and family. She sells a variety of goods according to the season. She sells door to door. She wants to buy Christmas products which are much in demand in this season. With her last loan she bought a variety of Christmas decorations, small trees etc. In this way she makes her living. She has done this for a long time so she has many clients who prefer her, more all the time.

loans.use: to buy a variety of Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Hermosilia

texts.en:
Hermosilia is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Hermosilia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Hermosilia has been buying and selling livestock for 20 years and earns additional income from tobacco vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and married with six children. With five of her children currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Janet has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jeber

texts.en:
Jeber is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 37 years old. 

Jeber has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Jeber requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Jeber has been in this business for two years. Jeber would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Deysi Marleny

texts.es:
Deysi es una persona de 33 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de venta de tortilla, en el centro del pueblo; su familia está conformada por solamente su hija que estudia en el instituto nacional, la señora trabaja todos los días en el pueblo para darle los gastos del estudio a su hija.

Su hija le ayuda en la época de vacaciones a trabajar en la venta de tortillas, además su ex esposo le aporta  también ya que el emigro a los estados unidos. La cliente es muy conocida en la zona donde vive y además participa en cosas religiosas, es muy activa.  

Deysi sea dedica a su negocio desde hace 4 años, ya que es su único negocio que tiene para sostener a su hija y a ella esta experiencia la obtuvo trabajando, para otra persona. Luego se independizo y puso su propio negocio hasta el día de hoy sigue trabajando, ella no posee otras actividades; ya que ella tiene que atender su negocio que es a una distancia de 150 mt y camina todos los días, su hija también la ayuda en la venta de tortilla. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maíz a su hermano, para tener para elaborar las tortillas; además de eso también cierta parte de dinero, lo utilizara para cancelar una deuda pendiente que tiene.

Este préstamo le mejorara el negocio, ya que tendrá suficiente grano de maíz, para no quedarse sin vender, y tener cuando el cliente llegue a solicitar tortilla.  

El sueño de toda madre, es ver que su hija pueda llegar a graduarse de bachillerato y alcanzar una meta grande.
texts.en:
Deysi, 31, has a business selling tortillas in the center of her town.  Her family is comprised of only herself and her daughter, who studies in a public school.  Deysi works every day in town to pay for her daughter's educational expenses.  Her daughter helps her with the business, selling tortillas during school vacations.  In addition, her husband supports her with remittances; he emigrated to the United States. 

Deysi is very well-known in the neighborhood where she lives, and she also participates in and is very active in religious activities.  Deysi has had her business for 4 years.  It is the only business she has to support her daughter.  She obtained her experience by working for another person.  Later, she became independent, and she started up her own business.  Up until now she continues to work; she has no other economic activities, as she must tend to her business, which is a distance of 150 meters from her home.  She walks there every day, and her daughter helps her with the business. 

Deysi is requesting a loan to buy corn from her brother, so that she can make tortillas.  She will also use part of the funds to pay off a debt that she has.  This loan will improve her business, because she will have enough corn to ensure that she has tortillas to sell, and so she will be able to meet the demands of her customers.  The dream of every mother is to see her daughter get a high school degree and achieve her greatest goal.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Jeleta

texts.en:
Jeleta is 56 years old and married with nine children. In the agricultural business in the Philippines, she buys and sells livestock. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional goats to sell.

Jeleta has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed 17 times from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goats to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and works hard to support her family. For the past three years she has bought and sold clothes in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is applying for a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell. Her ambition is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 32, is a married woman and has three children who are in school. She works hard to support her family.

Josephine has sold fish in the Philippines for the past year. She is applying for a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She is working to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy an additional box of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Jovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Munmun

texts.en:
Munmun, age 24, is a housewife. She lives with her three children and husband in their own Kachha house (straw and mud made) at Nirendrapur in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband Sahidul, 35 years old, is a farmer. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their son reads in Class II (Grade 2) and their daughter is in Class I (Grade 1). The other daughter is below school-going age.
 
Her husband works on their small plot of land and grows green vegetables, which he sells in the local market to provide their family's income. Her greatest expense is food and educational expenses for their children, which she cannot cover with her husband's small income.

Munmun asked for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes on their land. She has chosen potato cultivation since it is a very profitable business in their area and is in great demand in their locality and in the present market.

Her plan is to meet the financial needs of their family and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Pobitra

texts.en:
Pobitra is a 27-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two sons in the small village of Kathalbari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She received an education up to Class IV (Grade 4). Her husband Bimol is 27 years old. He is illiterate and can only sign his name. He is engaged in agricultural work. He grows green vegetables on their small piece of land. He learned his work from his father and he has been doing this work for many years. They live in their own Pacca house (made of concrete). Their two sons are receiving an education. They are in IV standard (Grade 4) and II standard (Grade 2), respectively.

Pobitra is a very hardworking lady and helps her husband in cultivation. The earnings are not sufficient to maintain their lifestyle, and pay the education costs for their children and the household expenses.

Pobitra heard about Kiva partner BJS and applied for a loan to start cultivating potatoes. She will use the loan to buy good quality potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes to have a great crop and sell the potatoes in the local market, as there is a great demand in the present economy.

She dreams of making adequate income to improve her family's quality of life and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rongmala

texts.en:
Rongmala is a 30-year-old married woman. Her family consists of her husband and a small daughter. She passed Class VI (Grade 6). Her husband Sukumar, age 35, is a carpenter by profession. He has received a primary education. Their only daughter reads in Class II (Grade 2).

They live in their own small kachha house (mud and straw made) in the small village of Nirendrapur in the district of Jalpaiguri. The main source of income for the family is her husband's business, which is not going well at present. She decided to start a new business growing potatoes to help her husband.

She learned about Kiva partner BJS and applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes on their piece of land. She is very hopeful that the cultivation will be very profitable, as there is a great demand for potatoes in the local market. She is motivated to give her full effort to start a successful cultivation business. She also hopes to give her daughter a good education in a good school and to give additional financial support to her family.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva both for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna, a 23-year-old housewife, lives with her only son and husband Nimai in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their small kachha house (a house made of mud, bamboo and straw). Krishna attended school up to class V (Grade 5), but her husband completed a higher secondary education (Grade 12). Their only son is below the school-going age.

Krishna's husband Nimai, 32 years old, is a farmer.  He has been farming their small land for many years and supplements their family's income.  But the current business does not provide them with enough money to meet their family's needs.  Financially, she wants to give support to her husband and family. She wants to start her own business cultivating potatoes on their land to in the local market. She has given preference to this business since potato cultivation is a very profitable business in their area. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland to cultivate potatoes and produce more. She hopes that the business will provide sufficient support to run her family well and give a good education to her only son.

Her desire for the future is to be able to build her own house with the profit generated from this business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis septembre 2013.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche et levant la main,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 32 ans,elle est mariée et mére d'une fille et de 03 garçons.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 12 paires de chaussures à 1500f l'une et 10 tenues de vêtements prêt à porter à 2500f la tenue.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group was established on September 2013. It is made up of members who live in the same village; they all work as small traders.

The person on the extreme left and raising her hand is our featured borrower.  She is 32 years old, married and mother of a girl and three boys.

With this loan she intends to buy 12 pairs of shoes costing 1,500 Francs a pair and 10 ready-to-wear clothing at 2,500 Francs per outfit.

Her goal is to increase her savings and meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear children clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Judith has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.  Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Iraq and is the sole provider of the family. 

Salah owns a small cafe, where people come to relax, drink coffee, and smoke the famous Arabian hubble bubble. He also provides food services for his customers. He has been in this field for more than seven years and established his own business in 2011. Salah's business grew fast, and he now has four employees. He gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area and is well-known in his neighborhood. 

Salah is requesting a loan for $1,500, which he will use to buy a freezer, a cooler and some extra chairs and tables. Salah is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a cooler and some extra chairs and tables

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29-year-old single man, who has been selling cars for thirteen years. He has very good experience in this domain since he had to start working at an early age to help his parents make their living and cover their expenses.

Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his wedding expenses and to buy the necessary home furniture that he needs. This is his fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. All of his previous loans helped him a lot in developing his business in a well-managed way.

He hopes to keep expanding his business in the future through opening a car-selling showroom.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses and to buy the necessary home furniture that he needs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 38 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, ages 3 and 4, who are presently in school and live at home. She completed 7th grade before starting her business. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past two years she has been selling soap, flour, sugar, milk, etc., in a shop around the local market, and she sells six days in a week from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. She likes her business because it is a fast-going business. She started this business by selling bread. She uses a taxi to buy her stock.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, flour, sugar, milk, etc., for her business. Her plan is to build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, flour, sugar, milk, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Abdiallah

texts.en:
Abdiallah is a 26-year-old man. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen.  Abdiallah's business is a grocery store that he started two years ago with limited capital. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Though he has been working hard, he can't meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital, as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him grocery supplies. 

He managed to attract more clients. He was happy about attracting new clients, but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business progress and growth. So, he took out a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business more and increase his profit.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.name: Ovidio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ovidio tiene 39 años de edad, es soltero, reside en una comunidad  del Municipio de La Másica, Departamento de Atlántida.
Ovidio se dedica a la venta de alimentos a través de una pulpería desde hace 4 años. 
El decidió establecer este negocio debido a la falta de empleo, anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo de jornalero en haciendas de ganado vacuno.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 17,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de maíz, fríjoles, arroz, manteca, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo y limpieza, refrescos y útiles escolares para tener al inicio de año que comienzan las clases en las escuelas.
El espera seguir creciendo en su negocio ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ovidio, 39, is single and lives in a community in the town of La Másica in the department of Atlántida.

Ovidio has made a living selling food in a grocery store for four years.  He decided to start this business because he didn't have a job.  Previously he worked as a day laborer on dairy farms.

Currently he has requested a loan for 17,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy corn, beans, rice, shortening, bread, condiments, toiletries, cleaning products, sodas, and school supplies to have at the beginning of of school year.

Ovidio hopes to continue growing in his business and offering a greater variety of products to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy food, toiletries, cleaning products, and school supplies

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en:
