Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique de vêtements.
texts.en: Valere Parfait is a 44-year-old man who is engaged and the father of 4 children aged between 3 and 13. Three of his children go to school. He has been a seller for 20 years at a local market, where he sells second-hand clothing for men, women and children (depending on seasons and the content of the clothing bale). He is forced to go to the unpacking each week and buy the clothing he displays on his counter at retail prices, because of the limited size of his capital. This does not allow him to earn much, hence the importance of this loan which will enable him to buy a bale of mixed clothing. He will save the profits he makes thanks to this loan so that he can open a clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.ru: Жамал 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей, вместе с семьей Жамал проживает ее свекровь, которой 81 год. У Жамал - среднее образование, сама Жамал в сезонное время, то есть летом и осенью занимается продажей фруктов, овощей, молока и сельхоз.продукций с арендованного помещения, а так круглогодично на протяжении 23 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жамал занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка, 15 овец, также имеет небольшой земельный участок на котором выращивает корм для скота- многолетние травы, кукурузу. Корм для скота заготавливается собственными силами Жамал и ее семьи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Jamal is 50, married, and raising 3 children together with her husband.  Her mother-in-law, an 81-year-old, also lives with the family.  Jamal has the equivalent of a high school education, and works seasonally in the summer and fall selling fruits & vegetables, milk and other farm products from a room she rents as a shop.  Year-round, she earns a living by raising livestock, and has been doing so for the past 23 years, first starting with 8,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her monthly income is around 4,500 som, and her farm currently has 2 dairy cows, a horse, 2 calves, and 15 sheep; she also has a small plot of land to grow fodder for livestock, e.g. various kinds of perennial greens and corn.  Jamal and her family all work hard to harvest and store fodder for their animals.

To continue to develop her farm, Jamal is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy some more cows.  She plans on using any extra money that the loan will allow her to make to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to set aside money for home repairs.

loans.use: buy cows.

loans.name: Thomas Rodrigue

texts.fr: Thomas est un homme âgée de 26 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il a ouvert un bar dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 01 an environ. Il bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Il voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps surtout avec l'approche des fête. ceci augmentera non seulement son chiffre d'affaire mais aussi son bénéfice. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille en partie et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Thomas is 26-year-old man, single, and with no children. He opened a bar in a district of the capital that he has been managing for about one year. He benefits from good experience in his field.

Thomas wants to use this loan to increase his stock of drinks so that he can satisfy his ever-increasing customer demand, especially during the approaching holidays. This will help to not only increase his merchandise turnover, but his level of income as well. The revenue he earns will enable Thomas to better meet the needs of the family, and to reinvest in his business so that he will be able to expand.

loans.use: to increase his stock of drinks.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba vit avec son conjoint Frigoriste et leurs 04 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle a démarré la vente des produits d'alimentation générale à la devanture d'un cafétariat. Le premier crédit l'aidera à acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. elle souhaite à l'avenir ouvrir une boutique et assurer la bonne scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle a démarré en 1996 et âgée de 45ans.
texts.en:
Ayaba is 45 years old and lives with her husband, a refrigeration mechanic, and their four children in Lomé. The children are all in school. To help her husband with the family responsibilities, Ayaba started selling general food products in front of a cafeteria, a business she has been running since 1996.

Her first loan will help her to purchase more merchandise to better serve her customers. In the future, she hopes to open a shop, and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase general food products for sale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, a 35-year-old from Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children.  

In 2008, Fatmata established her food stand business. She began her business to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says the main challenge with her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Fatmata requires a loan to purchase more pepper, onions and tomatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will enable her to take care of her children's education and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open a food-stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, onions and tomatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret  is married with three children. Only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house. The family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Gorret has a business of selling green bananas. She has been in this business for 20 years. She works at the market seven days of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation. She will use the loan to buy more bunches of green bananas. She joined MCDT-SACCO because of its low interest charges.  

Gorret aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Manos Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5  mujeres   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellas  residen en el distrito del Agustino. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “MANOS EMPRENDEDORAS” una de ellas es Hortencia  de 40 Años de edad soltera y con 2  hijos, hortencia se dedica hace  2  años al servicio de costura remalle hortencia confecciona prendas de vestir, en un pequeño local (alquilado) con el fin de progresar día a día y sacar adelante a sus hijos, ah sabido ganarse a los clientes  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Hortencia  solicito el préstamo  para comprar confecciones de vestir (telas) la vez  hortencia   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Hortencia   se le distingue con una blusa  manga larga de color negro ,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas
texts.en: This is a group made up of 5 women. They are responsible for different commercial activities. All of them llive in the district of Agustino. These are the members of the “MANOS EMPRENDEDORAS” communal group. One of them is Hortencia. She is 40 years old, single and has 2 children. Hortencia has worked as a seamstress for 2 years. Hortencia makes items of clothing in a small locale (rented) in order to progress day to day and get her children ahead. She knows how to get customers and thus be able to improve her quality of life. Hortencia asked for the loan to buy sewing materials (fabrics). At the same time, Hortencia and all of the other members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the trust that has been put in them. Hortencia can be seen in the long sleeved black blouse. She takes her leave, promising that she will meet all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 28 años, es una mujer joven, amable y muy buena, actualmente es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad a quienes cría con mucho amor y brindándoles toda la atención que necesitan, vive en la casa de sus padres y junto se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. El trabajo de Rocío consiste en la venta de cosméticos, entre los productos que vende tiene polvos faciales, lápiz labial, perfumes, colonias, shampoo, talcos y otros artículos para el cuidado de la piel y del cuerpo. Lleva realizando este negocio hace 6 años y vende sus productos principalmente entre sus amigos y familiares bajo el sistema de entrega crediticia, posteriormente realiza la cobranza. Afirma que trabaja sola ya que así sus ganancias económicas se incrementan. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo para estar a lado de su familia, le va muy bien ya que sus ganancias superan a su inversión inicial, más adelante espera establecer una tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos con mayor comodidad además de otros accesorios y prendas femeninas.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de cosméticos como perfumes, colonias, talcos y otros productos con los cuales espera incrementar sus ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Rocío, 28, is a young, kind and nice woman. She is currently single and has two children aged 12 and 9. She raises them with great love and gives them as much attention as they need. She lives with her parents; they fight together in order to get ahead.

Rocío works selling cosmetic products such as face powder, lipstick, perfumes, cologne, shampoo, talc and other products for skin and body care. She has been doing this for six years and her customers are mainly friends and relatives. She sells on credit and collects after some time. She says that she works alone in order to receive more profits. What she likes about her job is that she can manage her own time and leave some time to spend with her family. She is doing well now that the profits exceed the initial investment. In the future, she hopes to open a store where she can sell her products in a more comfortable way, and sell also accessories and women’s clothes.

This time she will request 3,000 PEN. She feels happy with the financial support she is getting to continue with her business. She promises to pay the installments on time.

With the requested amount, she will buy cosmetic products, such as perfumes, cologne, talc and other products. With this investment, she expects to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk, such as perfumes, cologne, talc, etc.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana de 54  años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de la zona central de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables y con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad ha luchado por ver crecer su negocio y mantener sus ventas. Y su mayor reto fue formar a sus hijos en profesionales, a pesar de las muchas adversidades que pudo pasar a lo largo de estos años.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  una librería que ofrece productos como cuaderno, lápices, estuches geométricos, papel rustrió, borradores, broches de archivos, crayones, correctores, marcadores, resma de papel bond, papel legal y carta y demás materiales de oficina y colegio. El objetivo del crédito es surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la entrada a clases de los colegios y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diaria, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. Ana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old, married, and has two adult children.  Ana is originally from the central area of the region and is hard-working, responsible, and has a desire to do better than she ever has before.  Ana has fought to expand her business and maintain her sales.  Her biggest challenge has been getting her children through university but, after years of difficulties, she managed it.

Thanks to Ana's efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has  stationery shop, selling products such as notebooks, pencils, geometry sets, glossy paper, erasers, folders, crayons, white-out, marker pens, bond paper, legal sized paper, card, and more office and school supplies.  The aim for this loan is to stock up her business as school classes are starting up again soon and Ana wants to be able to cover her customers' demands.  Ana works eight hours per day and enjoys her job.  Ana is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping poor countries such as Nicaragua and for helping those with little money to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy notebooks, pencils, geometry sets, glossy paper, erasers, folders, crayons, white-out, marker pens, bond paper, legal sized paper, card, and more office and school supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He describes himself as ambitious. John operates a retail shop where he runs an M-Pesa business (a mobile-phone-based money-transfer service). He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a place with a lot of potential and he has all types of primary customers.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to add M-Pesa float (electronic credits that serve as virtual currency in the mobile money industry) for his customers to withdraw. His business goal is to grow and have financial stability within five years. He hopes that in the future he will excel in business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add M-Pesa float (electronic credits that serve as virtual currency in the mobile money industry) for his customers to withdraw.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 23 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año, tiene un terreno propio en donde ha construido su casa, sin embargo, por el momento vive en un cuarto alquilado cercano a su centro de labores. El negocio de Rebeca consiste principalmente en brindar servicio de atención a pacientes con alguna dolencia o que requieren de atención médica inmediata o rutinaria. Es una mujer profesional que está haciendo de su carrera técnica de enfermería una forma de vida ya que considera que la vida y la salud de las personas son los aspectos más importantes del ser humano. Trabaja en local alquilado en compañía de otra enfermera quien le ha enseñado todo lo necesario para cumplir bien con su trabajo y gracias a ello puede atender a cualquier persona que necesite ayuda brindándole los cuidados requeridos o la orientación necesaria para que sean atendidos por un médico especialista. Lleva en este negocio más de 1 año. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará artículos de salud como guantes quirúrgicos, alcohol, algodón, jeringas y algunas pastillas para malestares leves.
texts.en: Rebeca, 23 years old, is a brave, and plucky woman.  She is married and has a one-year-old baby.  Rebeca has her own land where she has built her own house but, for the moment, she is living in a rented room near to her work.  Rebeca has a business offering health services to patients with pains or who need immediate or routine medical attention.  Rebeca is a professional and is studying nursing at university as she believes that peoples' lives and health are the most important aspects of being human.  Rebeca works in rented premises with another nurse, who taught her everything she needs to know in order to her job well.  Thanks to this support, Rebeca is able to help anybody needing help - she can provide the necessary care or give them the necessary information to ensure they are treated by a specialist doctor.  Rebeca has bee working in the business for over a year.  On this occasion she is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support as she will feel more secure as she progresses with her business.  Rebeca promises to make her repayments on time.  She will use this loan to buy healthcare items such as gloves, alcohol, cotton, syringes, and some pills for minor pains.

loans.use: to buy health supplies, such as alcohol, cotton, syringes, and more.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet Marie, who is in her early thirties and is from Jui in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. Three years ago, Marie established her general stock business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain her family's standard of living. She works at the business from 8 AM to 7 PM seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand it.

Marie requires a loan to purchase a variety of items, like cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasoning, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become successful and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to a build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items, like cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasoning, to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 47-year-old married woman with two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, bananas and other vegetables and has been involved in this business for five years.

Lucy's business is located in a place with a lot of potential and has all types of primary customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate funds. 

She will use the 35,000 KES loan to add stock, such as tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock, such as tomatoes, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: Gracias a un crédito de Kiva obtenido el año pasado María Teresa compró fertilizantes para sus fincas, las cuales dieron una muy buena producción. Para esta cosecha ella solicita nuevamente un financiamiento para pagar a los cortadores de café que contratará para trabajar en sus cafetales.
texts.en: Thanks to a Kiva loan granted last year, María Teresa could buy fertilizers for her plantations, which gave her a very good yield. She is again requesting a loan for this season to pay the coffee pickers she will hire to work in her coffee plantations.

loans.use: to pay the coffee pickers.

loans.name: Erika Mercedes

texts.es: Erika anteriormente había solicitado financiamiento para su cultivo de hortalizas las cuales fueron afectadas por la aparatiosa y la mosca blanca afectando sus cultivos de Chile dulce dañando una excelente producción y trayendo pérdidas para ella, su familia y demás que hicieron posible fortalecer sus cultivos con su primer financiamiento. Su primer financiamiento ayudo mucho para fortalecer sus cultivos pero siempre afecto dañando tres tareas de tierra de cinco que había cultivado y el producto que ella salvo no tuvo el desarrollo normal por esa misma razón Erika solo ha podido vender un parte del producto y eso ha sido atraso en su compromiso ya que perdió aproximadamente más del 70% en efectivo y cultivo; pero aun así ha tratado de mantener su financiamiento al día por lo cual se ha quedado sin ingresos para este tiempo. Nuevamente ella hoy viene más comprometida que nunca a la cooperativa COMIXMUL donde ha sido apoyada en financiamientos anteriores para que se le apoye con otro financiamiento por lo que debido a la pérdida del producto ella ha decidido dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y cumplir con su compromiso de pago ya que en su familia la agricultura es una vocación y una tradición por lo que la experiencia para cultivar otra clase de productos es favorable y con experiencia.
texts.en: Erika had previously applied for a loan for her vegetable crops, which were affected by disease and insects.  This damaged her otherwise excellent sweet chilis and caused a loss in profits for Erika, her family, and everyone else who did everything they could to strengthen the crops with this loan.  Erika's first loan helped a great deal in supporting her crops but with damage done to three fifths of the land she had planted on, the crop could not be saved.  As a result, Erika was only able to sell part of her yield and so she had difficulties paying back her loan, after she lost some 70% of her cash and crops.  However, Erika still tried to keep her payments up to date and she has been without an income during this time.  Now, Erika is back at COMIXMUL, where she was first supported with previous loans. More dedicated than ever, Erika is applying for another loan.  However, following the losses with her last product, Erika has decided to grow corn and fulfil her promises to make her repayments.  Farming is a vocation and a tradition in Erika's family and so there is experience in growing other products.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her corn crops.

loans.name: Achima

texts.en:
Achima is a 49-year-old housewife.  She is from the rural village of Altagram in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband Yasin, 50 years old, and three children (two sons, one daughter). She has received primary education and her husband attended school up to grade 8.  Two of their children are students; the third one is a mason by profession. They have a semi-pacca house (brick-built but thatched roof)

Achima's husband is associated with agriculture, harvesting green vegetables.  He sells them in the market.  His business is the main source of income for the family.  Now they have decided to cultivate potatoes in their land.

Achima heard about BJS and has taken a loan to purchase manure, fertilizers and potato seeds to grow potatoes. She hopes this business will help her to earn additional profit as there is a great demand for potatoes in that area and the product has a good potential in the present market.  The profit from her business will help her economically to meet the expenses of the family and educate their children properly.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Pushpa

texts.en:
Pushpa is a 42-year-old woman. She is from the village of Purba Mallick Para in Dhupguri town at Jalpaiguri District. She lives with her husband Bablu and her only son.  Both of the parents are illiterate and can sign their names only.  Her only son works in an electrical goods shop and works hard to help his family financially. She is a homemaker and her husband is a cycle van puller. 

Puspa’s husband delivers goods and vegetables to the market shops. The villagers also use his van as a means of transport in the village and pay the travelling charges to him. He hires and pay rent on a cycle van from a local owner, so he is unable to make sufficient income.

Pushpa is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase their own cycle van to generate more income. She has chosen this business because the demand for cycle vans is very high in their area. Their high volume of work will create a steady income and it will make her possible to build a concrete house from the profit of her business. Pushpa is taking the loan from BJS and Kiva to prove that it is not too difficult to overcome financial hurdles if financial assistance is received, and so that she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 30 years old. She lives in the small town of Dhupguri with her four children. Both parents are illiterate and only know how to sign their names. All of their children are doing higher studies though their parents are illiterate. Sabita is a housewife and always busy with all the household work. Her husband is a farmer who farms different kinds of vegetables and sells them in their local market. He has been involved in this business for many years but is unable to generate sufficient income for the family as well as for children’s education. Their earnings are too low to be favorable for Sabita's family’s daily expenses. 

Sabita is now requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes. She hopes that with the income from this business she can improve the financial condition of her family. She will purchase potato seeds and fertilizers along with new agricultural land to farm potatoes regularly with the loan money. This will enable her to earn a large profit from this business and she will be able to run her family smoothly. She may also be able to give her children more education as desired with the profit from this business.

Sabita is thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending their hand by funding loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is a 29-year-old from Jui, Eastern Area in Freetown. She is single with one child, age 3 years old. For the past three years, Fatmata has established her general store business. She began her business so as not to be involved in any illegal activity and to secure her life. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of items such as cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become successful and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items such as cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business

loans.name: Marta Angelica

texts.es: Doña marta de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella trabaja como domestica en una casa que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Marta esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una lampara salvasol que es una lampara de carga con energia de paneles solares, dirigida principalmente a hogares del area rural que carecen de conexion de energia electrica, por esa razon esta solicitando el credito y poder comprar dicha lampara que muestra en la fotografia
texts.en: Marta is 45 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter. She works as a maid in a house that is close to where she lives. With what she earns from her job, she is able to pay for the household expenses. Marta is asking for a loan to buy a Salvasol lamp, which is a lamp which charges from solar panels. It is mainly for homes in rural areas without electricity. That is why she is asking for the loan, so she can buy the lamp shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mirna Liseth

texts.es: Mirna de 25 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su compañero de de vida y su pequeño hijastro de 5 años de edad. Mirna se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de pan dulce y francés para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de ampliar su panadería invirtiendo en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración del delicioso pan. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de harina de pan, azúcar, huevos, colorantes, etc. Para contar con mayor capacidad y así cubrir una mayor demanda.
texts.en: Mirna is 25 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and her young 5 year old stepson. Mirna makes and sells a type of sweet bread and French bread. For this she has decided to expand her bread bakery, investing in buying ingredients necessary to make the delicious bread. Because of this, she has decided to ask for this FUSAI loan to invest in buying bread flour, sugar, eggs, food coloring, etc., so that she can have a greater capacity and cover a higher demand.

loans.use: to buy bread flour, sugar, eggs, food coloring, etc.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 32 years old.  She is a married woman and a housewife. She received primary education.  Her husband Mahesh, aged 31 years, is illiterate and can only sign his name. He is a farmer who grows seasonal vegetables. He has seven years of experience in this field, which makes him an experienced and skilled farmer. They live in their own house in the small village of Altagram in the Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri, with their three children (one son and two daughters).  All the children are students in secondary standard.

Gita's husband usually sells his crops at the market in his area.  His produce has good demand in the market.  Raising crops takes a lot of strength.  This needs very hard work and that's why Gita helps him in agricultural work after managing her household work.  

Now they have decided to start potato cultivation on their land. Gita needs some capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers to farm potatoes.  They chose the business because it is a profitable one, and there is great demand in the market.  They applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS for this purpose.

This business will give her an opportunity to earn profits to fulfill Gita's dreams, such as financial development of their family, providing education to her children and improving her business to secure their future.

In the future she wants to purchase a car with the profit from this business and  hire it out as another means of income.

Her thanks go to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as enterprising. She operates a grocery store, where she sells bananas, tomatoes and other groceries. 

She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a very good place for business, and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of products. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add stocks of vegetables and other groceries. Her business goal is to be a supplier of grocery products within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her financial status. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stocks of vegetables and other groceries.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 39-year-old married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

His business is located in a busy and convenient area, and his primary customers are local residents. He says that his biggest business challenge is a lack of enough funds. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 25-year-old woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. Her business is located in a potential area for business, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of enough funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add to her stocks of beauty products to use in the salon. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add to her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Meet Fatu, a 40-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. For the past 5 years, Fatu has run a retail business. She began her business because she wants maintain her family's source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Fatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of sugar to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: David Trinidad

texts.es:
El joven David es una persona de 22 años de edad, realizo sus estudios básicos en un centro escolar de la ciudad, pues mientras vivía con su  mamá residían en dicha ciudad; luego mientras realizaba sus estudios de bachillerato conoció a  la que ahora es su esposa. Ellos viven juntos desde hace 4 años y son padres de una niña. El joven David de dedica a la albañilería y trabaja en construcciones, también trabaja con su suegro en el cementerio remodelando nichos y su esposa trabaja de secretaria en un laboratorio clínico de lunes a sábado.
 
Él trabaja en la prestación de servicios de albañil de lunes a sábado y por temporadas trabaja como contratista con su suegro remodelando nichos en el cementerio, él cuenta con 4 años de ejercer este oficio, que aprendió de su papá, ya que él trabajaba como maestro de obra en proyectos municipales.

El dinero sera utilizado para complementar, el monto para la compra de un vehículo tipo pick up,el cual usara para transportar sus herramientas y material de trabajo ya que tiene idea de independizarse y trabajar como contratista con ayuda de su suegro y de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos económicos.
 
Las proyecciones que el tiene para un futuro, son las de tener un negocio de contrataciones de construcción y poder prestar un servicio mas completo; ya que contara con el servicio de transporte de materiales para la construcción.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old and completed his basic studies at a learning center in the city, and while he was living with his mother they lived in that city. Then, while he was in high school he met the woman who became his wife. They have been living together for four years and they are the parents of a little girl.
David is a bricklayer and works in construction.  He also works with his father-in-law at the cemetery remodeling burial niches.  His wife works as a secretary in a clinical laboratory from Monday to Saturday. 

David works as a bricklayer from Monday to Saturday and on occasion he works as a contractor with his father-in-law remodeling burial niches in the cemetery. He has been doing this work for four years and he learned it from his father who is a foreman on municipal projects. 

The money will be used to add to the amount he needs to buy a pickup truck which he will use to transport his tools and work materials so that he can become an independent contractor, with the help of his father-in-law. This will allow him to have a better income.

In the future he sees himself having a construction contracting business and being able to provide a more complete service since he will be able transport construction materials.

loans.use: to add to the money  he needs to buy a pickup truck to transport his tools and work materials so that he can be an independent contractor.

loans.name: Félix Alberto

texts.es:
Félix  es una persona de 33 años de edad, realizo sus estudios hasta 9° grado, el motivo por el cual  no pudo continuar con  sus estudios de educación media, es  porque en esa época no existía el nivel de bachillerato en ese municipio y desde entonces él comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura con su padre, luego con el tiempo trabajo con un amigo de su papá que tenia un taller de mecánica automotriz, trabajo en el taller de mecánica y fue comenzando a descubrir su habilidad para la rama de enderezado y pintura, fue adquiriendo experiencia y desde entonces trabaja en ese taller como pintor.

Él tiene un familia que esta conformada por su esposa, que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa y también tiene tres hijos dos niñas y un barón,  dos están en la escuela, la niña esta a un nivel de 7°grado de 13 años de edad, y el barón esta en 4°grado que tiene 10 años de edad.    


Él se dedica a la prestación de servicios como pintor en un taller, desde hace 11 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado, en horarios de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm. 
 

El dinero sera utilizado, para terminar de recoger las cosechas postreras, y para hacer un pequeño arreglo en en la infraestructura del techo de su casa, de esta forma asegurara sus cosechas en su casa y podrá ofrecer un lugar mas acogedor a su familia.


Las proyecciones que tiene  Felix,  para su futuro y eé de sus hijos son los de trabajar arduo para dar el estudio a sus hijos, hasta que logren ser unos profesionales. También  piensa en independizarse y tener su propio taller de enderezado y pintura de forma que tendrá un mejor ingreso económico y podrá suplir de una manera mas cómoda las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Félix is a 33 year old man. He went to school through the 9th grade. The reason why he couldn't keep going to school is because at that time there was no high school in that town. That was when he started to work in farming with his father. After time he worked with a friend of his father's who had an auto-mechanic's workshop. He started to discover his ability in the area of bodywork and painting. He acquired experience and since then he started to work in that shop as a painter. 

He has a family which is made up of his wife, who is a housewife, and three children, two girls and a boy. Two of them are in school, a 13 year old girl in 7th grade, and a 10 year old boy in 4th grade.    

He has worked as a painter in the shop for 11 years. He works Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  
 
The money will be used to finish harvesting the last crops and to make a small repair on the roof of his house. In this way he will secure his crops in his house and be able to offer a more comfortable place to his family. 

Felix plans for his and his children's futures are to work hard to give them an education until they can graduate from college. He is also planning on going off on his own and having his own bodywork and paint shop so that he can earn more income and be able to fulfill the household needs more comfortably.

loans.use: to finish harvesting the last crops and to make a small repair in the infrastructure of the roof in his house.

loans.name: Pharis

texts.en:
Pharis is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy more motorcycles within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 34 year old married man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells motorcycle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an area of good potential and his primary customers are motorcycle owners.

He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of motorcycle spare parts.
His business goal is to have a financially stable business within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will excel in business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet Adama, a 30-year-old woman from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child age 5 years.  

In 2003, Adama established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to maintain her family.   She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more pants, bras and vests to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to build a permanent business structure and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business to more than even her table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pants, bras and vests to expand her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Meet Emma, a 45-year-old woman from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has seven children. 

For the past 15 years, Emma has run a retail business. She began her business because she wants to maintain her family's source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Emma requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil and used bags to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Emma plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and used bags to expand her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes dresses to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area of good potential and her primary customers are the public. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of fabric, thread and other materials for making dresses. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a sustainable operation. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of fabric, threads and other materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 47-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 19 years. He describes himself as extremely committed. 

He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in an area of good potential and his primary customers are regular customers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as the low season. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will have a business that satisfies his family's needs. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 26-year-old married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as a determined person. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are small scale shoppers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of permanent place to do business. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell.

His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that he will have a brighter future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are the general public.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy beauty products to use in her salon.

Her business goal is to have a large salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to use in her salon

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 42-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a highly self-motivated person. He operates a retail store where he sells construction materials. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a conducive area for customers that has a market, and his primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds and transportation of products. He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of wire mesh, cement and other construction materials. 

His business goal is to reach a wider market within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will maximize profits and improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a motor vehicle for easy transportation of products.

loans.use: to add stock of wire mesh, cement and other construction materials

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Meet Musu. She is 45-year-old from Jui, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with four children. For the past five years, Musu has established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to maintain her family's source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Musu requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava and sweet potatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Musu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and sweet potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a carpentry shop where he makes chairs, seats, tables, etc. for sale. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy timber, nails and other materials for making furniture. 

His business goal is to own a big warehouse within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will live happily. 

This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although Esi did not have any form of formal education, this has not turned her down. She decided to set up her own kenkey business (kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She prepares her kenkey on her own and proceeds to sell it in Cape Coast. With over two years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty kenkey. 

She is a widow.  Esi aims at using the profits from her business to help support her four children with their upkeep and ensuring that they are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty kenkey.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Although Linda has received no prior formal education, Linda is a small-scale trader. She specializes in selling saucepans in Cape Coast. 

She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a welder. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their child’s school fees. 

Linda will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of saucepans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Sheyla Mercedes

texts.es: Sheyla de 25 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 5 años, cuando tomó esta experincia de su madre al ayudarla en su negocio, y posteriormente cuando empezó a estudiar en la universidad, su madre le dio un capital, para que trabajandolo en lo que ella habia aprendido, sustentara sus propios gastos e inició su venta de mercancias variadas, entre sus compañeros de clases y así fue creciendo poco a poco. Hoy su meta es ampliar su negocio,pues vende mediante guias especializadas de productos, y quiere ganar mucho mas, para finalmente, converirse en una profesional exitosa, por eso trabaja todos los dias persistentemente, vendiendo de contado y a crédito, ropa, accesorios, calzado y todo lo que la demanda de su clientela le exige. Su mayor desafio es la alta competencia, por eso acude a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará ropa, accesorios femeninos, y calzado, con lo cual diversificará un poco mas su oferta, responderá mucho mas a su demanda, y con ello se propone impactar a su clientela en la temporada del año, mas activa a nivel comercial, para ganar mas clientes y mas dinero.
texts.en: Sheyla is 25 years old and has been a merchant for five years, having learned about this from her mother when she used to help her in her own business, and later when she began studying at university, her mother gave her some money so she could work in what she learned, pay her own expenses, and sell some merchandise to her classmates.  In this way she began to grow her business little by little.  Now her goal is to expand her business, sell more products, and earn much more so she can become a successful professional.  This is why she works every day selling clothing, accessories, shoes, and whatever her customers request for cash and credit.  Her challenge is the competition and she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she can buy clothing, women’s accessories, and shoes so she will have a bit more to offer and response more to her demand and better serve her customers during this time of year, the most active commercially, so she can earn more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet Salamatu, a 40-year-old woman from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children.  

For the past eight years, Salamatu has run a snacks business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand it.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more eggs, cooking oil and chicken to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, cooking oil and chicken to expand her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 27-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more curtains to sell. Her business goal is to have a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more curtains to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kaditu, a 45-year-old woman from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children.  

In 2009, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to maintain her family. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like bags, cream and perfume to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to build a permanent business structure and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bags, cream and perfume to expand her business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as experienced. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable place, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 80,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her business goal is to have a sustainable business within five years.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet Mariama.  She is 30 years old and from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single, with one child 5 years old. 

In 2003, Mariama established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to maintain her family.   She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase different kinds of clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to build a permanent business structure and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business even more.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Tity

texts.en:
Meet Tity. She is a 30-year-old from Jui, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2006, Tity established a retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generates a permanent source of income to take care of her family. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Tity requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil and flour to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Tity plans to open a bakery. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil and flour to expand her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Meet Musu. She is a 30-year-old from Jui, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with children. In 2000, Musu established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Musu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her children's education and increase her business. In the future, Musu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 30 years old and married, with three children. 

She runs a domestic products business in the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She started her business because she wanted to improve the condition of her family.  

She's been in this business since after the war, and she sells glass cups, knives, and food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is an improper business location.

Zainab requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Fatmata from Tombo, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

For the past seven years, Fatmata has established a baby clothing material business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is moving door-to-door to introduce her goods, which is very difficult.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more pants, vests, and baby clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and to have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more pants, vests, and baby clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Elvira

texts.es: Ana  vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos de belleza, cuadernos, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que ofrece y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder surtir mas su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own house with her three children. She makes a living selling clothes, beauty products, notebooks, etc. Her business is located at her house and she has many clients thanks to the variety of products she offers and their good prices. She is able to support her children with what she earns. 

Ana is requesting a loan to buy more products in bulk and stock her business. This way she will be able to increase her income and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, beauty products, notebooks, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel, es un joven de 29 años de edad, es muy trabajador ejemplo a seguir, hoy en día el joven está alquilando una habitación, donde descansa cuando llega del trabajo, ya que es muy pesado, porque se moviliza mucho de un lugar a otro.
Manuel tiene 3 años de trabajar en una funeraria, donde desempeña el cargo de vendedor de ataúdes, visita muchos lugares para venderles a las personas, además es muy conocido y recomendado por los propietarios de la funeraria.
Con el préstamo se estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda comprar una motocicleta, ya que visita muchos lugares lejanos y tiene la necesidad de penetrar otros cantones donde el acceso es limitado.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia, con una familia muy bonita.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 29-year old young man. He is very hard-working and an example to follow. He is currently renting a room, where he rests after work, which is very tiring and implies moving a lot from one place to the other. Manuel has worked in a funeral home for three years. He sells coffins and needs to visit many places. He is popular and recommended by the funeral home owners. 

The loan will be used to buy him a motorcycle, given that he needs to visit many distant places and enter cantons with limited access. His dream is to have his own house and a beautiful family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 39 year old and operates a retail store where she sells charcoal, which she has been doing for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are the general public. Her biggest challenge is lack of funds.

Lydia is requesting her second loan from SMEP DTM for 50,000 KES, which she will use to buy more charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married, with one child. She has received schooling through the end of junior high school level. 

Currently, Grace sells saucepans and plastics in Cape Coast. She has been involved in this industry for about two years now. She walks around some parts of Cape Coast in order to make sales. Her husband is a teacher. Grace’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

She will use the loan to increase her existing capacity of saucepans, plastic buckets, and plastic bowls. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Grace plans to further develop her business by venturing into newer markets and having a fixed location for her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her existing capacity of saucepans, plastic buckets, and plastic bowls.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Yatta Married from Tombo western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Yatta runs a palm oil business at home; she sells palm oil and beans. She has been running this business for 15 years now. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Yatta says that the main challenges to her business are  transportation prices and insufficient funds for expanding her business.

Yatta has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 7 years, Kadiatu has been running her clothing material business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge in her business is the difficulty of moving door to door to introduce her goods.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family's welfare. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the region of Kampala South in Uganda. She is married and has four children, who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells bags and clothes of all kinds. 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and bags, and will help Catherine to generate greater profits and enable her meet other basic needs and pay her children's school fees in time. Catherine hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up another business in Konge. 

Catherine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Catherine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and bags

loans.name: Habert

texts.en:
Habert is a 46-year-old married man with 4 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a security officer but also practices agriculture in order to earn additional income. He has hardships of low pay and the general price fluctuations of agricultural products. His vision is to have educated children plus starting up a shop for his wife such that they join hands to look after their family.
 
Habert intends to use the requested loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 50-year-old, married man, with six children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He is a farmer and that's how he earns a living. He also earns an additional income from his monthly salary. He started farming after buying a leaf from his neighbor who is a model farmer in his village. He has hardships of price fluctuations and seasonal changes. John has a dream of educating his children to higher levels and of becoming a model farmer. 

John intends to use the loan to buy manure and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abaham is a twenty-six-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is agriculture but he also earns additional income from monthly payments. He is a large-scale farmer and faces hardships of lack of enough manpower to do digging on time because of using manual labour, Another challenge is price fluctuations. His vision is to become a rich man in future. 

Abraham intends to use the loan to buy oxen for ploughing.

loans.use: to buy oxen for ploughing.

loans.name: Thiane

texts.fr: Madame Thiané est une femme veuve  et mère de famille. Elle habite dans un quartier de la commune et évolue dans la commercialisation des légumes. Elle dispose d’un étale au marché et commence sa journée à 10 pour la finir vers les couts de 18h. Thiané sollicite ce montant pour acheter et revendre des légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans cette activité et prend en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. A l’avenir, elle souhaite avoir un champ ou elle cultivera du maraichage et avoir aussi des boutiques au niveau du marché pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Mrs. Thiané is a widow with children. She lives in a neighbourhood of the town and she sells vegetables. She has a stall at the market and starts her day at 10 am and finishes it on the chimes of 6 pm. Thiané requests this loan to buy vegetables for resale. She has over 20 years' experience in this business and provides for the daily expenses of her family. In the future, she hopes to have a field where she would grow the produce and also shops in the market in order to increase her income and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a domestic product inTombo western rural area in Freetown. She started her business because she wanted to improve the conditions for her family. She's been in this business since after the war. She sells glass cups, knives and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem to her business is improper business location.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and varieties of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
This is 49 year old Viola, from Liberia. More precisely, she lives in the Caldwell area; this area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads and affordable rent. Viola is married to a contractor. They have 3 children. Two of her children live at home and attend school. 

Over the past ten years, Viola has been selling oil and pepper.  She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business other than finding good supplies at reasonable costs. Her best trading comes at traditional holidays and Christmas.
She is requesting a loan to buy more oil and pepper. In the future, she wants to support her children and buy some land.

loans.use: to buy more oil and pepper.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a thirty-five-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop but he also earns a monthly salary from teaching as his additional income. He has hardships of competition and price fluctuations. His family dream is to provide for his home. His vision is to own a wholesale shop. 

Dickson intends to use the loan to buy more goods like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is brick making but he also sells goats and sheep in order to earn additional income. He has hardships of weather changes especially the rainy season, where his bricks take a long time to dry yet he expects constant income. His dream is to have a machine for making bricks. 

Faustino intends to use the loan to buy materials to make more bricks to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana de 28 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad. Mariana posee una tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Su deseo es ampliar su tienda con el fin de mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos ya que desea dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida a las que ella y su esposo han tenido. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: huevos, cereales, golosinas, aceite, macarrones, detergente, etc.
texts.en:
Mariana, age 28, lives in her own house together with her husband and her two children, ages 10 and 12.  

Mariana has a store in her home where she sells a variety of staples.  Her wish is to expand her store with the goal of improving her sales and her income. She wants to give her children better living conditions than what she and her husband have had.  Because of this, she is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of products for her store such as: eggs, cereal, snacks, oil, pasta, detergent, etc.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cereal, snacks, oil, pasta, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es: Wilberto, es padre de un hijo de 11 años de edad a quien apoya  en su educación  entre otros gastos, Wilberto se dedica a trabajar como mecánico tornero en un taller y su esposa atiende una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, Wilberto desea repellar las paredes y piso de su humilde hogar que con tanto esfuerzo y sacrificio ha venido levantando por etapas, con el financiamiento que solicita podrá comprar los materiales como cemento, arena y el pago de la mano de obra, lo que vendrá a mejorar cada vez más sus condiciones de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilberto is the father of one child, age 11, whom he supports in his education, among other expenses.  Wilberto works as a lathe operator in a workshop and his wife runs a small convenience store in their home.  

Wilberto wants to add a pebbledash surface to the walls and floor of the humble home that, with great effort and sacrifice, he has been building in stages.  With the loan he is asking for, he will be able to buy materials such as cement and sand, and pay for the labor.  This will improve, bit by bit, the living conditions of him and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement and sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilio es un agricultor de 48 años de edad, él no posee ningún grado de escolaridad y apenas sabe leer un poco, no sabe escribir ya que cuando era niño no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela; ya que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos y por esa razón tenia que trabajar para ayudar a su familia. Su esposa lo abandono y a su cargo quedaron 3 hijos a los cuales esta tratando de sacar adelante, uno de 10 años de edad, el segundo de 8 años de edad y el más pequeño solamente tiene 5 años. Este ultimo hijo, tuvo un incidente que le  causo quemaduras significativas y eso le ha generado desde hace un año asistir a terapias hasta la capital;  es  por esa razón que el señor trabaja en la agricultura y el comercio de especies menores (gallinas, cerdos, pescado,etc), para mejorar sus ingresos ya que necesita un dinero extra. Don Teofilo es cliente de la Fundación Campo, un muy buen cliente y este seria su segundo crédito con la fundación.

Don Teofilo en la parte de la agricultura posee un conocimiento amplio, ya que desde niño se dedico a este rubro. En el área del comercio con especies menores cuenta con unos tres años de experiencia,  él ha podido identificar una buena oportunidad de inversión, ya que le genera unos ingresos dignos para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, motivado por esa razón, Don Teofilo desea invertir en el negocio del comercio de especies menores, ya que ya posee clientes y por eso le es mas fácil vender su mercadería y volver a invertir.

El crédito otorgado será utilizado para realizar una inversión en el negocio de comercio de especies menores, es decir para la compra de mas mercadería (gallinas, cerdos, pescado, etc), lo cual le permitirá ofrecer una mejor oferta a la demanda que le exigen sus clientes y así mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y en especial poder completar el tratamiento que recibir su hijo menor a causa de las quemaduras provocadas por un accidente.

Las metas que como familia tienen para un futuro es, apoyar a sus hijos mediante la educación y que sean unos profesionales, ademas que el negocio del comercio de especies menores sea cada día mas competitivo, rentable y este satisfaciendo a sus clientes, ofreciendo los mejores productos en lo relacionado a especies menores por temporadas. Con el apoyo de Fundación Campo, espera hacer este sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Teofilio is a farmer.  He is 48 years old and did not attend school.  He barely knows how to read and doesn't know how to write.  He did not have a chance to attend school when he was a boy.  His family was of scarce resources and he had to go to work to help the family.  His wife left him and his three children, ages 10, 8, and 5 and he is trying to get them ahead.  The youngest one had an incident that caused him significant burns and for the past year he has had to go to the capital city for therapy, so this gentleman works in farming and selling small animals (chickens, pigs, fish, etc.) to improve his income and earn some extra money.  Teofilo is a good client of Fundacion Campo and this will be his second loan.

Teofilo knows a lot about farming because he has been doing this since he was a boy and selling small animals for three years.  He has been able to identify a good investment opportunity, since it generated dignified income for him so that he can get his children ahead.  He wants to buy small animals.  He has customers and sales are easy.

He will use the money from this loan to invest into his small animal business and buy more merchandise (chickens, pigs, fish, etc.) so that he can meet his customer demand and improve his family finances, especially be able to complete his son's treatment due to the burns he received in the accident.
