The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mable’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and works as a primary school teacher in Chemojech A village in Vihiga, Kenya. Chemojech A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Robert and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Robert works as a schoolteacher, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Robert and other promoters in his community (including Alice, Konzolata, Josephine and Kevin) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Robert  will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Robert wants to be a promoter because he is reliable and honest, and he believes that the dispenser will promote good health. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Robert’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: José Silvano

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad,  es un hombre muy trabajador, que a pesar de no haber estudiado, aprendió el oficio de la albañilería que hoy realiza. Actualmente, vive con su hijo de 8 años que estudia 2° grado y con su compañera de vida, quien se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalago. Ademas de vender,  su compañera de vida, cuida 2 vacas que tiene José, ya que una esta en producción y es necesario darles los cuidados pertinentes.

José  pasa trabajando de ayudante de albañil por 25 años y después decidió poner en practica todo lo aprendido de sus compañeros de trabajo. También, tiene 2 vacas atrás de la casa, de las cuales una esta en producción de leche.

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando,  para que pueda comprar una vaca en producción de leche y así poder tener mas ingresos. Ademas, podrá hacer quesos para darle a su hijo una buena alimentación. 

José,quiere en un futuro dejarle a su único hijo, unas vacas para que pueda valerse por si mismo.
texts.en:
José, who is 35 years old, is a very hardworking man.  In spite of not having studied, he learned the masonry profession, in which he works today.  He lives with his 8-year-old son who is in second grade, and with his life partner, who sells beauty products from a catalog. In addition to selling, José’s life partner also takes care of his two cows, as one of them is producing, and it is necessary to provide them with appropriate care. 

José had been working as a mason’s helper for 25 years, and he decided to put into practice everything that he learned from his co-workers.   Also, he has two cows behind his house, one of which is producing milk. The loan will be helping him to purchase a dairy cow, and thus he will be able to have more income. Also, he will be able to make cheese so that he can provide good nutrition for his son.

In the future, José wants to give some cows to his only son, so that he will be able to provide for himself.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Co Kho Group

texts.en:
Thiet (wearing orange coat with branch in hand) is the elected team leader of Co Kho Group, which consists of eight Thai women. 

Thiet is 26 years old and married with two children. One is in second grade and the other is just two years old. Thiet lives with her mother-in-law and supports a nephew who is studying in vocational school. 

Cultivating rice is Thiet family's main production, but it doesn't bring enough income for her family's needs, especially because of the bad harvest. 

Correspondingly, growing vegetables and cereals, breeding poultry and cattle are additional agriculture activities that her family is doing now.  Not only that, Thiet's husband works in the construction field.  To increase income, Thiet wants to apply for a loan from Anh Chi Em Program to expand her business.  Specifically, she would use a portion of loan to buy piglets. 

This is Thiet's first loan in the Anh Chi Em Program and she hopes that through this loan, her family's living standard could be improved.  She dreams that her children will get the best education, go to university and escape the vicious circle of poverty.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Nery Elena

texts.es: Nery Elena mayor de edad casada con dos hijas menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es propietaria y administradora de un camión con el que presta servicios de transporte de carga pesada a través de contratista a empresas privadas y estatales específicamente traslado de semilla de maní, actividades que se desarrollan en el occidente de nuestro país, Inicia su negocio con capital propio producto de sacrificios propios y de su familia, Nery desea realizar cierto cambios en su hogar en un futuro no muy lejano instalar cerámica a mi vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito es para activo fijo en la compra de llantas optimizando, mejorar su unidad de trabajo para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.-
texts.en: Nery Elena is a married woman with two dependent daughters. She was born in Chinandega in eastern Nicaragua. She owns and manages a truck, which she rents to companies and government agencies to transport heavy loads, specifically peanut seed, in eastern Nicaragua. She started the business with her and her family's hard-earned money. Nery wants to make improvements to her home and install tile soon. She will use this loan to buy quality tires for her truck so that she can offer her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy tires and equipment for her work vehicle.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
Telma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more LPG tanks needed in her business. This business has been running for two years now. Her loan is helpful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. She and her husband are both working to provide for their everyday expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Telma dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a vacation with her family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Khujamberdi

texts.ru:
Хучамберди житель села района Кубадиён. Ему 57 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Хучамберби работает учителем физкультуры в школе. Это его профессия, но не основная деятельность. Дополнительно он занимается земледелием и еще имеет свой маленький магазинчик по продаже продуктов питания. Хучамберди на своей земле выращивает пшеницу. Ему по работе помогает его семья. 
   5 лет назад Хучамберди открыл свой магазин по продаже продуктов питания. До сих пор его магазин осуществляет свою деятельность. В ассортимент его продукции входят сладости конфеты, напитки и другие продукты. Хучамберди просит кредит, чтобы расширить свой ассортимент продуктов. Он считает, что с расширением различности товара увеличится количество его покупателей.
texts.en:
Khujamberdi is a resident of a village in the Qubadiyon region. He is 57 years old. He is married and has children. His wife is a housewife. Khujamberdi works as a physical education teacher. This is his profession, but not his main activity. In addition he works with farming and also has his own small grocery store. 

Khujamberdi grows wheat at his land. His family helps him with the work. Five years ago, Khujamberdi opened his grocery store. He still operates his store. His product assortment includes sweets, candy, drinks and other products. Khujamberdi requests a loan in order to expand his product assortment. He thinks that expanding with different goods will increase the number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase food products and expand the assortment at his store

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín, es soltero, vive junto a su hijo se 12 años, no posee ayuda del extranjero, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para darle lo necesario a su hijo se dedica a vender tamales, atiende de su negocio de 5:00 a 10:00 p.m. y de 1:00 a.m. a 7:30 p.m., es una actividad que no le a representado ningún problema en realizarla.
Invertirá en la comprara elotes y aceite, estos ingredientes son parte de su materia prima para seguir trabajando, Benjamín espera aumentar la producción de tamales, aumentar sus ventas, tener mejores ingresos y seguir teniendo satisfechos a sus clientes.
Sueña con comprar un vehículo, terminar de pagar su casa y darle una carrera universitaria a su hijo.
texts.en:
Benjamín is single and lives alone with his 12 year old son. In order to make a living and provide his son with what he needs, he works selling tamales from 5:00pm to 10:00pm and again from 1:00am to 7:30am. He does not face many difficulties with his work. 

He will use this loan to buy corn and cooking oil, ingredients that he needs to make his tamales. Benjamín hopes to increase his production, improve his sales, earn more money and continue satisfying his clients' needs. 

His dream is to one day be able to buy a vehicle, finish paying off his house, and provide his son with a university education.

loans.use: to buy corn and cooking oil

loans.name: Carlos Misael

texts.es:
Carlos, es casado y padre de un niño de 6 años, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, el posee una tienda y venta de tortillas es apoyado por su esposa, también sale a vender cinchos y carteras, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de cinchos, carteras, maíz y leña, tendrá fortalecido su negocio para estas épocas que las ventas aumentan, espera mejorar los ingresos, cancelar sus deudas y seguir atendiendo más clientes.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is married and has a 6-year-old son, who lives with him and his wife. Carlos and his wife run a tortilla shop and also sell rings and purses; they currently don't have any problems with the business. He will use the loan to buy rings, purses, corn, and wood to stock his business for this season when sales are strong. He expects to increase his earnings, pay his debts, and continue serving customers. He hopes his business is more profitable so that he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rings, purses, corn, and wood.

loans.name: Alba Lely

texts.es:
Alba, se decidió por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de verduras como papas, güisquiles, repollo, tomates, uvas, papayas entre otros, con lo que ofrecerá a sus clientes variedad de productos a sus clientes y de esta manera mantendrá su fidelidad.
Con el crédito anterior compro el producto necesario para que su negocio se fortaleciera, aumento sus ventas y su economía es más estable, con lo que ha tenido la oportunidad de cancelar sus deudas y cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alba has decided to invest, by means of another loan, in the purchase of vegetables like potatoes, güisquiles [a kind of gourd/squash], cabbage, tomatoes, grapes, papayas, etc.  With these purchases she will offer her customers a variety of products and in this way maintain their loyalty.

With earlier loans she purchased the products necessary to strengthen her business and increase her sales.  Her finances are more stable which has given her the opportunity to pay off her debts and change her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like potatoes, güisquiles, cabbage, tomatoes, grapes, papayas, etc.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a educar y darle lo necesario a sus hijos, es casado sus hijos tienen 12 y 10 años, para cubrir los gastos de su hogar el negocio consiste en atender su granja de pollos, es apoyado por sus hijos en esta actividad, por lo que no tienen  problema en atenderla.
Comprará concentrado, pollos de engorde y vacunas, los cuales son necesarios para tener un negocio muy rentable, al adquirir estos productos espera aumentar las ventas, mejorar su economía, ya que las próximas fechas de fin de año es cuando tiene mayor demanda de sus clientes.
Sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y darles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan devotes himself to educating and providing whatever is necessary for his children. He is married, and his children are 12 and 10 years old.

In order to cover household expenses, his business is to attend to his chicken farm. His children help him in this business, which is why he does not have trouble tending it.

With the loan, he will buy chicken feed, chickens for fattening and vaccines, which are necessary to have a profitable business. When he gets these products, he hopes to increase sales and improve his financial situation, since the coming days at the end of the year are when he has the most demand from his customers.

He dreams of growing his business and giving his children a college education.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, chickens for fattening and vaccines.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old, has 2 daughters and 3 sons, and lives in Gimarakwa A village in Vihiga, Kenya. Gimarakwa A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Jane and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Jane works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Jane and other promoters in her community (including Zablon, Bilhah and Josephine) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Jane  will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and will refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Jane wants to be a promoter because it gives her an opportunity to learn more about safe water and she also benefits directly. Jane believes that the chlorine dispenser is a simple, economical and helps in disease reduction, unlike alternative methods of treating water which are complicated and costly.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Jane’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Morine's Group

texts.en:
Morine, an active member of the Women's Group, lives in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor and an iron roof in Ikonza A village in Vihiga, Kenya with her family which includes 4 children. The community of Ikonza A village collects their drinking water from a river, stream, or other flowing water source because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Ikonza A’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Ikonza A, 14 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Morine has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are two other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Luka and Enos. 

Ikonza A village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Morine believes that the dispenser will help to prevent diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Morine’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Leonidah's Group

texts.en:
Leonidah is 70 years old, has a 45-year-old daughter and a 42-year-old son, and she lives in Busingo village in Vihiga, Kenya. Busingo village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Leonidah and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Leonidah works as a subsistence maize farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Leonidah and other promoters in her community (including Harrison and Aggrey) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Leonidah will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and will refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Leonidah wants to be a promoter because she is well-liked so she hopes it will be easy for her to educate her community on water treatment. She believes that the dispenser will kill germs in the community's drinking water. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Leonidah’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
In Geminoi village in Vihiga, Kenya, Joyce has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Joyce is a hardworking well-liked member of the community with 3 children. Joyce lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Geminoi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a stream. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Joyce and the 22 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Joyce has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Joyce volunteered to be the promoter because she is involved in developmental projects and she wants to help the community by making water safe. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Grace, Maguli, Abraham, and Mariam.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joyce’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Susana Patricia

texts.es: Susana 28 de años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella trabaja como domestica en una casa que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, susana esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una lampara salvasol que es una lampara de carga con energia de paneles solares, dirigida principalmente a hogares del area rural que carecen de conexion de energia electrica, por esa razon esta solicitando el credito y poder comprar dicha lampara que muestra en la fotografia
texts.en: Susana, who is  28 years old, lives in her own house with her mother. She works as a domestic employer in a house near her place of residence. With this job she is able to cover some of her home expenses. Susana is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp ("Salvasol"), a lamp charged with the energy from solar panels, specially designed for homes in rural areas which lack connection to electric power. For this reason she is asking for a loan to be able to buy such lamp, which is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de Maria mayor de edad madre soltera  con dos hijas uno aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, es propietaria y administradora de su propio negocio de comercialización de ropa usada el cual lo tiene establecido fuera de casa donde alquila ofrece mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisas, trajesitos, entre otros para damas, niños y caballeros, compra ropa seleccionada y también pacas, Inicia su negocio con capital propio producto de su liquidación por trabajo social desempeñado en uno delos ingenios mas grande de esta zona, uno de los cambios que ella desea realizar en su hogar es el de mejorar su cocina, elevando el techo y cambiar cubierta así como instalar cerámica a su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital propio en la compra de  prendas de vestir y aprovechar la temporada alta de fin de año, seleccionando las mejores pacas y así ofrecerles mejor calidad a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder prosperar en su negocio y ver a su hija realizada profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is single with two daughters whom she is responsible for. She is originally from the municipality of Chinandega and is the owner and manager of her own business. Flor de Maria sells used clothing from a rented store space. She sells pants, blouses, shirts, suits, and other items for women, children and men. She buys individual articles of clothing as well as clothing bundles to stock her store. She began this business with her own money that she earned from a previous job. 

With the loan that she is currently asking for, she will invest in the purchase of new articles of clothing, taking advantage of the busy season at the end of the year. She will select the best bundles and therefore offer the best products to her clients. One of her dreams is to grow her business and watch her children grow professionally. Additionally, she would like to make some changes to her home, improving her kitchen, raising the roof and installing new flooring.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Wendy Yamali

texts.es:
Wendy Yamalí tiene 21 años de edad , vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, sus población se dedica al comercio, cultivos de arroz, azúcar y maíz siendo los más resaltantes, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza cremas, shampoo, joyas y cosméticos desde hace dos años, los ofrece por catálogos, visita a sus clientes en su domicilio y en instituciones donde laboran, por lo que es muy conocida en el medio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para invertirlo en la compra de los productos antes mencionados para tenerlos en stock y de esta manera ofrecerlos mediante una vitrina en su domicilio y así generar ingresos mayores para contribuir con su familia.
texts.en: Wendy Yamalí, 21, lives with her parents in the Cayaltí district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast. The residents primarily run businesses and grow rice, sugar, and corn. Wendy has been selling beauty products, creams, shampoo, jewelry, and cosmetics for two years. She sells catalog merchandise to customers in their homes and at work and is a well-known vendor. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy the merchandise mentioned for inventory so that she can showcase it in her house and earn more income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy creams, cosmetics, and jewelry to stock her business.

loans.name: Herlinda Rosa

texts.es:
Herlinda Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su domicilio donde ofrece venta de ropa y calzado para niños, damas y caballeros desde hace diez años, por lo que cuenta con importante clientela.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa de temporada primavera – verano y de esta manera abastecer a sus clientes y así mismo generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Herlinda Rosa is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun. The population of Oyotun makes its living in agriculture, ranching and commerce. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

Herlinda Rosa has a small business at home, where she has sold clothes and shoes for children, ladies and gentlemen for ten years, which is why she has a significant clientele.

She has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy seasonal clothing for spring and summer to supply her customers, so that she can earn a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for spring and summer.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela, tiene 51 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposo y su hija. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de carnes, lácteos, refrescos, churros, galletas, dulces, pan, arroz, azúcar, embutidos y carnes. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para sostener activo el negocio y obtener los ingresos familiares. El préstamo actual es por 6,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de refrescos, carnes, churros, pan y harina para vender y poder tener mejores ganancias. Su sueño es crecer como comerciante y que su negocio genere ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Ángela is 51 years old and is in a common law marriage with her husband.  She has two children and lives in the town of San Marcos, Santa Bárbara with her husband and daughter.  For 3 years she has been involved in the sale of meat, dairy products, soft drinks, churros, cookies, sweets, bread, rice, sugar, and sausages.  She has sought various loans to sustain the activity of her business and to secure her family income.  

The current loan is for 6,000 Lempiras ($300).  With it she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, meat, churros, bread and flour to sell in order to have better earnings.  Her dream is to grow as a trader, and that her business will generate income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, meat, churros, bread and flour to sell.

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pet shop business in the Philippines.

Maria Gina requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fish, fish food, etc. to sell.

Maria Gina has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Maria Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, fish food, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: El señor Sabino proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, del departamento de Oruro, tiene   51 años y su esposa  48, ya tienen más de 20 años juntos, cuentan con tres hijos, pero en este momento solo uno depende de sus ingresos, el cual está estudiando en la universidad y necesita el apoyo de sus padres.  Ambos se dedican a la elaboración de productos de carpintería (cajas acústicas) y prendas de vestir (blusas), por el buen trabajo y puntualidad, tienen un mercado consolidado y en constante crecimiento. No hace mucho tiempo gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo, logro comprar un lote, en la zona de Quillacollo, que ahora se encuentra a medio construir, es por ello que solicita un crédito para la construcción de vivienda, con el fin de ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Sabino comes from a humble and hardworking family from the department of Oruro. He is 51 years old and his wife is 48. They have been more than 20 years together and have three children. Currently only one of them depends on their income, being that he is studying in college and needs his parents' support. Both parents work in the production of carpentry products (acoustic boxes) and clothes (blouses). Because of their good and punctual work they have a consolidated market which is constantly growing. Thanks to their efforts, they were able to buy a lot in the area of Quillacollo, which is now half built. This is why he is requesting a loan to build a dwelling and offer his family a better life.

loans.use: To build a dwelling

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more fruits and vegetables of different kinds. Her loan is helpful not just for business but also for the education of her child. Her income from business is supporting their everyday household expenditures. Her business has existed for ten years now. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bella hopes that her business will last longer, and dreams to have a better living. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida previously obtained a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she used to purchase quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Adelaida is requesting another loan for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain her family's daily needs and educational expenses of her child. 

Adelaida hopes that her business will continue to flourish and that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Guiscela Adaliha

texts.en:
Guiscela dreams of becoming a systems engineer and is currently attending the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, working towards her degree. She expects to graduate in February 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Guiscela shares that it is important to her to graduate on time, so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Guiscela plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in systems engineering before graduating. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Guiscela currently works 40 hours a week as a graphic designer and earns $17 a day. With a degree in systems engineering, she expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Guiscela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Maria has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marta Teresa

texts.es:
Madre de 5 hijos y mujer trabajadora, con su negocio de costura ha logrado que ellos estudien; teniendo 5 hijos profesionales. Reconocida en la zona por la confección de ropa, arreglos y además elaboración de trajes y uniformes para actividades escolares, de bandas y cualquier cosa que le soliciten. Ha mantenido su negocio por más de 25 años, por lo que es solicitada por todas las instituciones de la zona. Trabaja con 2 maquinas caseras, cuenta con su taller propio y está terminando de pagar su carro.
Inicia ofreciendo sus servicios en la zona para el arreglo de ropa, se empieza a dar a conocer y a darle forma a su negocio.
Actividad consolidada en la zona, tiene un mercado fijo y su producto es de muy buena calidad. Desea este crédito para invertirlo en una máquina industrial, logrando aumentar su producción y así atender otros mercados; que ha logrado abrir con el vehículo que posee. Eligió Fundación Mujer porque ofrecen tasas de interés bajas y un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Marta Teresa is the hardworking mother of five children. Her dressmaking business allowed her to educate her children, who now have careers. She is known in the area for making and altering clothing and sewing suits and uniforms for school, band activities, and other uses. Because she has run her business for more than 25 years, local institutions use her services. She has two home machines and her own shop, and she has just payed for her car.  

Originally Marta offered alterations in the area; she become know and started her business. Her business is strong, her clients are loyal, and her merchandise is high quality. She wants to use this loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to increase output and to service other markets that she now reaches by car. She chose to work with Fundación Mujer because the institution offers low interest rates and good service.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah dreams of becoming a nurse, but without a degree, she knows it may never be possible. Sarah is currently attending the Universidad Mayor de San Simon, working towards her degree in nursing. 

She expects to graduate in January 2015, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. For Sarah, it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a loan, Sarah plans on purchasing her much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Sarah feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Sarah currently works 30 hours a week in a store and earns $4 a day. With a degree in nursing, she expects to earn $13 a day. 

For Sarah's family of six, finances have always been tight. With four older siblings, Sarah is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for school books.

loans.name: Phean

texts.en: Phean is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Phean is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her to easily commute to work. In the future, she would like to run her own tailoring shop and build a new house, if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Phors

texts.en: Phors is 40 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a doctor who makes an income of $4 each day. To improve her family’s finances, Phors is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase medicine for her husband to resell. By doing so, he would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a bigger pharmacy and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 46-year-old laborious farmer in Lal-lo. He patiently works in the field because this is his primary source of income. Gained income from farming business goes toward the education of his child, as well as their daily needs. He really cares about his farming and hopes for the continuous growth of his rice crop production. 

As of now, he is asking a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional funds to improve his farming business. It would be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. He believes that this amount of loan will enable him to increase his yield and income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use for farming.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy more stocks of school supplies. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Ann hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more school and office supplies.

loans.name: Higidio

texts.es:
Higidio tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el caserío de Vista Alegre, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por un relieve accidentado, lo que le ha permitido tener diferentes pisos ecológicos donde se cultivan café, frutales, yucas, maíz, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, a cinco horas de la provincia de Cutervo, Región, Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo del cafeto de la variedad catimor tiene sembrando 2 hectáreas de su propiedad, actividad que realiza desde hace diez años, adicionalmente cría y vende ganado vacuno, de las cuales obtiene leche y hace quesillos los que vende en el distrito de Santo Tomas.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles, para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café comprando abono y de esta manera prevenir que la plaga de la roya ataque sus cultivos y así tener una buena producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Higidio, 41, lives with his wife in Vista Alegre, a rural area in Santo Tomás district located five hours from Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern mountains. The area has a rugged, stepped terrain on which coffee, fruit, yuca, and corn are grown. The residents sell these products and livestock. 

Higidio has been growing Catimor coffee on two hectares of his land for 10 years. He also raises and sells milk cows, and he sells the milk and cheese from the cows in the Santo Tomás market. He has applied for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy manure for his coffee crop to protect it from rust disease so that he has a good harvest to sell to his customers that will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Angie Esperanza

texts.es:
Angie tiene 20 años de edad vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Zaña, es una comunidad conocida por sus fiestas Religiosas, elaboración y comercio de dulces típicos de la zona, agricultura y ganadería, ubicado en la una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza mediante catálogos, realiza vistas a sus clientes con la finalidad de promocionar cosméticos, cremas y perfumes.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de perfumes, colonias y cremas de limpieza facial para tener en stock, para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para apoyar con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Angie is 20 years old and lives with her mother in the district of Zaña, located an hour and forty-five minutes from Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque district on the north coast of Peru. This community is known for it's religious festivals, the elaboration of traditional sweets of the area, agriculture and raising livestock.

Angie sells beauty products by catalog visiting her clients to promote her cosmetics, creams and perfumes. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 PEN to buy perfume, cologne and facial cleansing cream to have in stock to offer to her clients. This will generate more revenue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cologne and facial cream.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalie is 36 years old and all of her children are in school.

Rosalie has a food production business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian works hard to support her family. Marian is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marian requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to resell.

Marian has been in this business for eight years now.

Marian would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 65 years old and married with six children. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items, such as rice, soft-drinks, shampoos and other groceries. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 57 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Marilou has a food selling business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Marilou is requesting a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, eggs, etc. for her food business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, and eggs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business, like chicken, pork, chorizo, and bamboo sticks.

Marilyn has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business, like chicken, pork, chorizo, and bamboo sticks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rose has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rose requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

Rose has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old and married with two children. Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, chocolate drink, milk, etc. to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, chocolate drink, milk, etc. 

Marina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, chocolate drink, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria dreams of becoming a lawyer. She was accepted into the Universidad Pública de el Alto and plans on graduating in May 2014. 

Maria plans on using the loan to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in El Alto. Without financial assistance, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Maria currently works 25 hours a week and earns $9 a day. With a career in law, she expects to earn $17 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Maria's parents were never able to complete their primary education. With four younger brothers and three younger sisters, Maria hopes to be a role model by being the first in her family to graduate from university. 

Maria is married with her own children. With a professional degree and a career in law, she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Rosalva Marily

texts.es: Rosalva, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 años y 2 meses. Actualmente es costurera, tiene su taller en su propia casa. Beneficiara desea darle mayor comodidad a sus hijos es por ello que utilizará el crédito para remodelar y mejorar el dormitorio de sus hijos, para ello necesita comprar (cemento, ladrillos, puerta, pintura, entre otros.). Su sueño a corto plazo es comprarse otra máquina de coser y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosalva, 30, is married with two children, ages 2 months and 7. She is a seamstress and has a workshop in her own home. 

Rosalva would like to give her children greater comfort, so she will use this loan to remodel and improve her children's room. In order to do this, she needs to buy cement, bricks, a door, and paint, among others. Her dream in the short term is to buy another sewing machine and to continue improving her home.

loans.use: to remodel and make improvements to her children's room (buying cement, bricks, a door, and paint, among others).

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa, 40 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been operating a taxi service for local people since 2007. His wife has a managerial position at a hospital. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and is in need of some repair. Davaa is requesting a loan of 5,350,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials, including  bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam, to renovate his house. After renovation, the house will be a comfortable and warm place, where less coal burning is required and therefore less pollutants are released into the air. Also, the borrower wants to make his land flat in the near future, in order to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, 28 years old, lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling clothes in her workshop for a long time, and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her husband has the position of a decorator at a building company. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to install four electric heaters in her house. As a result, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to install four electric heaters in her house.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Nasanjargal, 59 years old, lives with her son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her elder daughter works in Korea on a labor contract and her elder son lives separately. Her younger daughter has a position of receptionist at a hotel. Her younger son has disability and gets pension. She herself has retired from work and gets retirement benefit. 

As winter came to Mongolia, she is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into air, which is beneficial to the clean air efforts.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam for house renovation.

loans.name: Narannyam

texts.en: Narannyam, 29 years old, lives with his mother and brothers in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Using his previous loan, he successfully launched a grocery store which is now run by his mother. One year ago, he began selling clothes by renting a stall at a trade center. He is requesting a loan of 3,800,000 MNT to buy clothes in large quantity from a China border city. Because his business is running well, he always has a goods shortage due to lack of cash. So the loan will enable him to increase his working capital thus increasing income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who has responsibility for caring for his mother and younger brothers.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantity.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo esta casado, vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciudad de La Paz. Guillermo es  de profesión grafico.
 
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas en la zona de Villa Fatima lugar donde hay una imprenta ya que su profesión es gráfico, percibe un sueldo con el cual mantiene a su familia.
El crédito que solicita es para pagar la inscripción de su hijo en la carrera de mecanica.
 
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Guillermo is married.  He lives in his own home in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone in the city of La Paz.  Guillermo is a graphic design professional.

Currently he works more than eight hours in the Villa Fatima zone, where there is a printing house because his profession is as a graphic artist.  He receives a salary with which he takes care of his family.

The loan he is asking for is to pay the registration fees for his son to study mechanics.

This is the fifth time that he has asked for a loan from IMPRO, and the second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for his son to study mechanics.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 55 years old and married with 11 children. She earns a living by selling vegetables that are harvested from her backyard. She has been planting a variety of vegetables for over three years. This has helped her family in their daily living, as the profits from her business were spent on their daily expenditures and electric bills. 

Florida decided to request a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP to buy seeds to grow vegetables, including squash, bitter gourd, and string beans, to sell. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow vegetables, including squash, bitter gourd, and string beans, to sell.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark wants to be an accountant someday. He is still studying at Stella Maris College for a degree in Accountancy. He helps his parents on their farm during weekends and also has a part-time job earning a little money for his basic needs. His previous loans from GDMPC were used for his school fees for the last school year. Recently, he requested a new loan to pay for second-semester tuition fees. He hopes to finish his course and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay for second-semester tuition fees.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 45 years old from Nakuru. He is married and they are blessed with seven children aged 23, 18, 15, 11, eight, six and two and half years old.

He sells boiled eggs to customers in his town, a business he has been running for the last year. To enable him buy more stocks of these eggs so as to serve more customers, he has applied for his first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD.

His monthly income right now is KES 18,000 and his plan is to use profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to own a very big hotel in his area.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of eggs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 26 years old, married to Catherine, and supports a family of four. He runs a retail shop, and he also does farming for additional income. He has been in business for the last two years; he gets an average monthly income of KES 18,000. 

He plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 60,000 to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat for resale. He will use the profits from the retail shop business to venture into another business that he will decide on.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. Her variety store which has been running for two years is continuously growing. She also has a tricycle and a boarding house for additional income. All of her businesses benefited from the loan that she borrowed. It also was helpful in the education of her children who are in grade school and high school. Her husband is also helping her in generating income for their family.
 
She would like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes that the time will come that she will no longer borrow money and dreams that her children will have a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
Cornelia tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de La Matanza, es una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora y comida arroz con pato, cabrito, seco de chavelo plato tradicional de la Región Piura, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos de maíz y azúcar para la elaboración de Chicha de jora y compra de arroz para preparar sus platos de comida y de esta manera abastecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cornelia is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and son in the district of La Matanza, two hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru. It is a quiet community where the inhabitants grow fruit, engage in commerce and raise livestock.

Cornelia sells chicha (liquor made from corn) and meals like rice with duck, goat, seco de chevalo, a traditional food of the Piura region. She has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy bags of corn and sugar to make her Chicha and buy rice to prepare her meals. In this way she will stock her business and generate more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and sugar.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a juice-vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May works hard to support her family. May has a live-in partner and has a general store business in the Philippines.

May requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like toothpaste, diapers, coffee, candies, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

May has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like toothpaste, diapers, coffee, candies, snack foods and soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora works hard to support her family. Melchora is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Melchora requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, seasonings, spices, etc. for her business.

Melchora has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Melchora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, seasonings and spices for her business.

loans.name: Merilou

texts.en:
Merilou is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merilou is 39 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Merilou has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merilou requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Merilou has been in this business for 23 years. Merilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
Nazaria is 54 years old and widowed with two children.

Nazaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Nazaria has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling used clothing.

Nazaria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela works hard to support her family. Pamela is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Pamela requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional unit for her business.

Pamela has been in this business for three years now.

Pamela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit for her business.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Pelagia is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Pelagia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Pelagia requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her fish stall.

Pelagia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Pelagia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her fish stall.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. Raquel is single and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Raquel requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Raquel has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Raquel would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky dreams of becoming a lawyer. She was accepted into the Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording the cost of her books. She plans on graduating in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Vicky plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. 

Vicky currently works 40 hours a week as a secretary to help afford her school and living expenses. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up in a family of seven, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings already attending college, Vicky is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Vicky's father's salary from his job as a mason is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan is currently attending UDABOL, working towards his degree in business administration. He expects to graduate in June 2014, but without a loan, he is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Juan shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Juan plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business administration before graduating. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Juan currently works 40 hours a week as an office assistant and earns $24 a day. With a degree in business administration, he expects to earn $30 a day. 

With one older sibling attending college already, Juan is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Tomieka

texts.en:
Tomieka has over nine years of cosmetology experience and takes pride in forming lasting relationships with her clients, many of whom are military families on tight budgets. When her employer of over seven years was ready to sell her salon, Tomieka jumped at the opportunity to own her own business. Using all of her personal savings, Tomieka was able to become the new owner of “A Touch From Above” salon.

Her challenges did not end there, however, as she faced the challenge of being a new business owner. Serving only to compound her difficulties in managing her own salon, the building her salon was in fell victim to arson one year ago. She shared, “After our businesses burned down, thirteen people were out of a job overnight.” Although she had fire insurance, it was not enough to cover the entire reconstruction of her space.

Determined to not let her business die, she looked for alternative sources of funding to bring her business back to life. She heard about microlending on a segment on the local news and applied immediately. “Making my clients happy, particularly for weddings and special occasions, is too rewarding for me to give up,” said Tomieka.

Tomieka will use her $7,500 Kiva loan to install new flooring and signage to finish her salon renovations, as well as purchase more inventory. 

She currently has five employees and hopes that her refreshed salon will allow her to expand to as many as nine.

loans.use: to install new flooring and signage to finish her salon renovations, as well as purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Beksultan

texts.en:
Beksultan is a freshman student in the Business Administration Program. Here is his story:

At the age of 16 I applied to the Future Leaders Exchange scholarship program. There were a lot of students from my region. It was the hardest competition I have ever faced. Finally, after all tests and interviews, they said that I won scholarship for an exchange program. I was so proud to go as representative of my country to share our cultural values with the people of America. I learned a new culture and this whole new world was opened to me. Everything was new and bizarre. I couldn't understand why people were using two garbage bins. My host mother explained to me that they recycle papers and cans. By recycling them they can reuse those same materials in the future. I wanted to find out more about recycling. Fortunately, my coordinator had a friend who was working in this field. We arranged a meeting. He showed me a factory where they were recycling paper. I was amazed by this place. We had a long conversation about recycling. He said that seventy-five percent of trash can be recycled without any chemicals and harm to the environment. But the main problem was how to manage a factory and efficiently use resources. Because of that I made it my goal to become a manager of recycling business.

After that day I started to think a lot about where I can find this knowledge. I had several ideas about applying to business schools in America but they were unaffordable for me and they were far away from my home country. Then I found out about American University in Central Asia which was one the best universities in whole region. When I was in Bishkek I had always heard about how AUCA students volunteered to help in communities through site cleans-ups, helping orphans, and helping homeless people. I always wanted to be one of them. Educationally, the university's programs were the best in Kyrgyzstan.They could provide me the knowledge which could help me to achieve my future goals. I want to gain experience and knowledge from studying in this university to make my future and the future of my country cleaner.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es: Gumercindo, es un señor trabajador que busca junto a su familia salir adelante, hoy en día mantiene a dos de sus hijos a quienes brinda educación y alimentación, junto a su esposa se dedica a la venta de pescados de  manera ambulante, de esta actividad sobrevive y paga los gastos del hogar entre otros, Gumercindo desea repellar el piso de la sala así también una pared frontal de su humilde vivienda, para este motivo solicita el crédito para poder comprar los materiales para dicha obra y así ir mejorando poco a poco las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is a hardworking man who, along with his family, is looking to get ahead. He provides for two of his children, giving them food and their education. Along with his wife, he sells fish as a traveling salesman. With this business activity, he survives and pays his household expenses, among others. 

Gumercindo would like to plaster the floor of his living room and build a frontal wall for his humble home. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy construction materials for this project so that he can improve his living conditions little by little.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and pay workers.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: El señor José vive en el municipio de Colomi, tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura y siembra en un terreno de 1,5 Has que es herencia de sus padres, en el mismo produce papa y papaliza, con rotación de cultivos, tiene xperiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 4 de engorde, 1 lechera y un ternero. Actualmente  requiere un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico 1.5 camiones y productos agroquímicos, ya que quiere aprovechar esta época porque los precios son bajos, asi podrá seguir trabajando y tendrá asegurado la siembra de papa y otros productos para la seguridad alimentaria y para generar mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en:
José lives in the municipality of Colomi. He is 21 years old, single, and financially independent. He works in agriculture, farming 1.5 hectares of land which he inherited from his parents. He grows potatoes and ulluco with rotating crops. He has experience in this field. He also owns cattle. He has four fattening cattle, one milk cow and one calf.

He currently needs a loan to buy 1.5 truckloads of organic fertilizer and agrochemicals. He wants to take advantage of this season because the prices are low. In this way, he will be able to continue working and he will insure his crops of potatoes and other products for food security and to earn a better income in the future.

loans.use: to buy 1.5 truckloads of organic fertilizer and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 47 years old from Nyahururu. She is single and a mother of three children aged 27, 23 and 21 years old.

She owns a private school, a business she has been running for the last eleven years. To enable her to buy teaching materials like chalk, dusters and desks to be used by pupils who enroll in her school, she has applied for her fourth loan of KES 80,000 from KADET Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan to KADET Ltd and to further expand her business.

Her hopes for her business in the future, is to own the most prestigious school in her area.

loans.use: To buy teaching materials like chalk, dusters and desks to be used by pupils who join her academy.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is 35 years old and has a spouse who provides additional income. They are blessed with three children, aged twelve, nine and five. She has been in business for nine years and her monthly income is 50,000 KES. She requested this loan to purchase an assorted stock of boutique clothes and to add M-Pesa float (electronic credits to sell in a mobile-phone-based money-transfer service). From the anticipated profits she will build her rental houses. This is her third loan. She repaid the previous loans successfully. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a healthy and happy life.

loans.use: to buy boutique clothes and operate M-Pesa (mobile money-transfer) services.

loans.name: Isabet Anguelita

texts.es:
Isabet tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el caserío de Contando una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales y comercio de los mismos, ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella brinda servicio de transporte público y movilidad escolar en su mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y así poder seguir brinda el servicio de una manera segura y generando ingresos para su familia,.
texts.en:
Isabet is 42 and lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of Contando, a rural area in the disctrct of Pucará. It is a community some two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. It is an area with a warm climate, where the people work in stock-breeding as well as in the cultivation and selling of fruit trees.

Isabet offers a public transport service and transports schoolchildren in her moto-taxi, carrying customers from adjoining hamlets to her community. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to maintain her vehicle and thus to be able to offer a safe service and generate income for her family.

loans.use: to maintain her moto-taxi [a three-wheeled motorised vehicle].

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, se decidió por otro crédito para la comprar de chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, gas propano y también hará mejoras en el local, para elaborar pupusas y tener satisfechos a sus clientes.
Con la inversión anterior tuvo un negocio con materia prima de calidad y una mejor imagen ante sus clientes, aumento sus ventas, tiene mejores ingresos, incluyo la venta de pupusas en su actividad económica y cancelo de forma puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Blanca has decided to ask for another loan to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, corn, and propane gas to make pupusas and satisfy her customers.  She will also make improvements to her point of sale.

She used her previous loan to buy premium quality ingredients so she could present a better image to her customers.  She increased her income and included pupusa sales into her business.  She repaid the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.


Rosalie requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, nylon thread, scissors, etc. for her business.


Rosalie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, nylon thread, scissors, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Libertina

texts.en:
Libertina is married with three children.  She was born on Sabu Island in the East Nusa Tenggara province of Indonesia.  Receiving only primary school education did not hinder her passion to become a successful entrepreneur.  She moved to Kupang, the province capital, to increase her opportunities.

Libertina is a tenacious entrepreneur with a strong passion to learn and improve her business.  She opened a small shop selling everyday goods and home-made donuts.  While the donuts were a success, business was a little slow in the highly competitive market of everyday goods. 

To increase her income, Ina has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.
