She will use the loan to buy products like solar lamps, water filters, and clean cooking stoves and grow her business.  Ina and her husband go to community meetings to educate people about the cost-savings and health benefits of these products. 

One of her dreams is to provide better education for her children.  The income from selling these technologies will help her increase savings for their future education.

loans.use: to help introduce simple, clean energy products to her community

loans.name: Marlen Margot

texts.es: Marlen, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Hace diez años que ella estableció una pulpería con el fin de obtener ingresos para su hogar, vende granos básicos, refrescos, churros, pan, dulces, azúcar, abarrotes y carne de cerdo. Ya a invertido tres prestamos en el negocio, con el actual es el cuarto ciclo y es por 22,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar cerdos para destazo y vender la carne, también va comprar granos básicos para la pulpería y aprovechar la temporada para incrementar las ventas. Ella piensa seguir con el negocio para poder darles buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marlen  is 41 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has two children.  She lives in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.  Ten years ago she set up a store where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, churros, bread, candy, sugar, groceries, and pork so she can bring some income into the household.  She has already invested three loans into her store and in this fourth cycle is asking for loan of 22,000 Lempiras to buy pigs to butcher and sell.  She will also buy some basic grains so she can take advantage of the  season and increase her sales.  She plans to continue her business so she can provide her daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María de 58 años de edad, el cliente estudio hasta 5° grado, es madre soltera de  5 hijos, 3 viven con ella, 2 trabajan y el otro estudia, vive también en su casa una esposa de un hijo de ella.


María posee un negocio (tienda) desde hace 10 años, se dedicó a ese negocio, ya que en la escuela del cantón no tenían una tienda o cafetín donde los estudiantes compraran. Antes se dedicaba a trabajar la tierra con sus hijos, el negocio se encuentra a 5 minutos de su casa, 

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ganado, ella quiere tener más ganado para generar más leche o poder venderlas en mejor precio.

Su deseo es que su hijo menor que está estudiando, pueda seguir estudiando y sacar una carrera universitaria y comprar más ganado, para que sus hijos tengan algo para poder trabajar y obtener o generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and has a fifth grade education.  She is the single mother of five children, three of whom live with her two work and the other attends school.  One of her children’s wives also lives with her.

Maria has had a business (store) for the past 10 years.  She started it because the local school did not have a store nor a café where the students could buy things.  She used to work the land with her children.  Her business is located five minutes from her house.

She will use the money from this loan from Fundación Campo to buy livestock.  She wants to have more livestock so she can produce more milk or to be able to sell them for a good price.

She would like for her youngest son to continue attending school and attend university.  She would also like to buy more livestock so that her children will have something to work with and have better income.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima is 40 years old and married with 10 children.

She has a small garden where she grows taro plants and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Iemaima needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wire, spade, wheelbarrow, and bush knives. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Iemaima will use the profits from her sales to pay her childrens' school fees and help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wire, spade, wheelbarrow, and bush knives.

loans.name: Ta'e

texts.en:
Ta'e is 51 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, which is sewing clothes. To earn extra income she also has a cattle farm. She has 3 years of experience in these businesses. 

Ta'e needs a loan to buy calves, barbed wire, materials, a new sewing machine, and threads. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy calves, barbed wire, materials, a new sewing machine, and thread.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has a boutique business in Kitengela where she sells clothes and handbags. She has been in this business for three years. She is 53 years old and married to Edward who helps provide additional income. They have been blessed with two children

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to open another boutique business.

Her future hopes are to be successful in her business and to be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and runs a business selling clothes in Makueni town. She has been in this business for two years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She is single and has four children. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes and jewelry to sell. She will use the anticipated income to buy additional varieties of clothing as well as pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business, to earn more income, and to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old. She is married to Joash and together they are blessed with four children. She has been in the milk selling business for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES). She operates her business in Kamobo center in Kapsabet town.

She has borrowed 80,000 KES and plans to use it to purchase more milk for resale. She will use the profits from the milk trade to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Nuraly

texts.ru: Нурали в ИМОНе кредитуется второй цикл. Он родился в сельской местности, и занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур и откормом скота. В этом бизнесе ему помогают жена, сыновья и невестка. Данным бизнесом Нурали занимается более 15 лет и имеет многолетний опыт по выращиванию сельхоз культур и откорм скота. Он выращивает картошку, морковь, пшеницу и ячмень. Половину полученного урожая продаёт по оптовой цене на рынке,  а половину использует для семьи и для откорма скота. Нурали запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони на покупку скота.  Предыдущий займ он погасил вовремя. Нурали ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
This is Nuraly's second loan cycle with IMON. He was born in a rural area and is engaged in growing crops and fattening cattle. His wife, sons, and daughter-in-law help him in this business, which Nuraly has been running for over 15 years; he has extensive experience in both crop cultivation and fattening cattle. Nuraly grows potatoes, carrots, wheat, and barley, and sells half of his harvest wholesale at the market and uses the other half for his family and to feed his cattle.

Nuraly is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni to buy cattle. His previous loan was repaid in a timely fashion. Nuraly is thankful for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Rosaura Aracely

texts.es:
Rosaura, se le presenta la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio para las próximas fechas navideñas, ya que es una buena época para incrementar los ingresos, comprara variedad de ropa con estilos, colores y tallas, tambien comprara bebidas, golosinas, jabón entre otros, para ofrecer a sus clientes un inventario surtido.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ventas, a mejorar  su economía, y ampliar un poco más su negocio. Las condiciones familiares en cuanto salud y alimentación han mejorado mucho
texts.en:
Rosaura has a chance to invest into her business for the upcoming Christmas season, since this is a good time to increase her income.  She will buy a variety of clothing of different styles, colors, and sizes.  She will also buy drinks, snacks, soap and other things so she can have a good inventory for her customers.
  
The previous investment helped her increase her sales, improve her financial situation, and expand her business a little more.  Her family health and alimentation have improved greatly.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Roselma

texts.en:
Roselma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Roselma has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 7000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more packages of frozen foods to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Roselma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packages of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Rosita has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Arlene is borrowing 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle for her tricycle transportation business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Coming from a farming family, Daniel lived from hand to mouth.  He grew up with a dream to be a ship captain.  He joined marine school but later dropped out because his family could not afford the cost of training.  Daniel was working as an honorary teacher before he decided to open a small shop selling everyday goods, toiletries and snacks.

To increase his income, Daniel has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy water filters, clean cooking stoves, and solar lamps and grow his business. 

His community experiences frequent power cuts.  Many households in Kupang still use traditional open fires or kerosene stoves which produce harmful smoke.  Kerosene is  expensive and rarely available.  The idea of fuel efficient lighting and clean cooking makes him keen to educate his customers in the cost-savings and health benefits of these technologies.

loans.use: to pay for clean energy products that will be sold to his community

loans.name: Hemdan

texts.en:
Hemdan’s mother-in-law owns a small kiosk selling everyday goods, snacks, bottled drinks, and toiletries.  Even though he does not own it, he regularly checks on the stock, manages the kiosk, and always looks for new opportunities to grow the business.  However, more shops have opened in his area and competition is tough.  He is looking for an innovative solution to improve his business.

To increase his income, Hemdan has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  He will use the loan to buy stock such as water filters, cooking stoves, and solar lamps. Hemdan also hopes Kopernik’s training program will improve his business skills.

Moreover, Hemdan also sees an opportunity from the solar lamp technology to answer electricity problems in Rote, a small island where he grew up.  He is a very proactive entrepreneur who markets his products to the community instead of passively waiting for customers.

loans.use: to buy simple, life-saving technologies and resell them in his community

loans.name: Johannis

texts.en:
Johannis has always wanted to be a successful entrepreneur.  For a long time he has wanted to start his own business but has not been able to decide what products or services to focus on.  He has held a variety of jobs to support his family but he cannot make enough money to support them as he would like to. 

Johannis has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies and fulfill his dream of becoming an entrepreneur.  He will use the loan to buy clean technologies such as solar lamps, cooking stoves, and water filters, and support the development of his new business.

Johannis is a very proactive businessman.  He regularly conducts product demonstrations to educate people on the cost-savings and health benefits of these products.  He is planning to use the proceeds from his new venture to save money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to sell simple, life-saving technologies  to his community.

loans.name: Félix Elisa

texts.es:
Félix es una mujer de  46 años de edad,  con nivel académico hasta séptimo grado. Es casada el esposo se dedica a trabajar en una ruta como motorista; ellos han procreado 6 hijos, los cuales todos viven con ella, tres trabajan y dos en la escuela y uno que pasa con ella en casa; por lo tanto solo tres hijos depende de ella.


Ella es sastre, tiene contrato con dos escuelas de la zona a quienes les hace uniformes, pero a la vez le cose a toda la gente que llegan con el corte de tela o sin la tela; ya que ella también tiene tela que vende. Este negocio lo aprendió en una academia, antes le trabajaba a una amiga siempre en lo de coser; pero vio que el negocio era bueno y decidió prepararse más en una academia y poner su propio negocio y ponerlo en la casa para poder trabajar hasta bien noche y en lo propio.

El préstamo solicitado en Fundación Campo, es para comprar cosas de primera necesidad para el negocio como telas hilos, sippers, broches, botones y todo lo que le sea útil  y le traiga ganancias en el negocio; el préstamo mejorara mucho porque comprara por mayoreo.

El mayor de sus sueños es tener todo muy equipado y tener gente trabajando, para obtener un ingreso a sus familias y así tener más ganancias y poner un negocio grande en donde se les den las oportunidades a las personas del cantón y utilizar las ganancias en lo productivo y ampliar mucho el negocio poder poner una súper sastrería.
texts.en:
Félix is a 46 year old woman with a 7th grade education.  She is married, and her husband works as a driver.  Together, they have 6 children, all of whom live with them.  Three of the children work, two are in local schools and one stays at home with her.  For the time being, only three of her children depend on her.

She works as a tailor, and she has contracts with two local schools, for which she makes the uniforms.  However, she also sews for anyone who comes to her with or with out the fabric since she also sells fabric.  She learned this trade in an academy.  Before this, she worked for a friend doing sewing work.  She began to see that it was a good business, and decided to learn more in an academy in order to open her own business in her home so she could work until late at night.  

The loan she is seeking from Fundación Campo, will be used to purchase business necessities such as fabrics, thread, zippers, clips, buttons and anything else that will be useful and bring in money to her business.  The loan will improve a lot because she will purchase in bulk.  Her biggest dream is to have everything well stocked and have employees, in order to provide their families with incomes and increase revenues, as well as be able to open a larger store where they will have more opportunities to interact with people from the area.  She also wishes to use her earnings to expand her business and be able to open a big tailor shop.

loans.use: purchase business necessities such as fabrics, thread, zippers, clips, buttons and anything else that is useful.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer esta casado y vive en casa de los padres en la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz,  de profesión confeccionista de Banderines.
 
Actualmente trabaja por mas de diez horas en su propio domicilio con ayuda de su esposa, todos los dias confecciona banderines,los mismos que entrega según el pedido cada fin de semana ya sea en la ciudad de La paz como en los pueblos cercanos. Con esta actividad el se mantiene y cubre las minimas necesidades de su familia.

Wilmer solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales:tela de hilo, nylon,stickers, etc., para que tiene pedidos para fin de año y tnedrá un incremento en sus ingresos.
 
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Wilmer is married and lives in his parents' home in the Alto Chijini zone of La Paz, he works making banners.  Currently, he works over 10 hours a day in his own home with the help of his wife.  He makes banners every day, and delivers them every weekend to the city of La Paz or other neighboring towns.  

With this work, he maintains himself and covers the basic needs of his family.  Wilmer is seeking this loan to purchase materials such as: linen cloth, nylon, stickers, etc., because he has orders for the end of the year, which will increase his earnings. This is his fourth loan with IMPRO and his first with KIVA.

loans.use: purchase linen cloth, nylon, stickets, etc. for his banner making business.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is 47 years old and married to Zacharia. They have been blessed with six children. She has a rental housing business and has been in this business for four years. Her spouse provides additional income. Right now, her monthly income is 15,000 KES.

She plans to use this loan to renovate her rental properties and to pay school fees for her children. The loan will enable her children to get a good education. Rodah anticipates to make more income from her business due to the high housing demand in the area. She will use the profits to repay the loan and to continue paying school fees for her children. 

In the future, she hopes to build more rental houses, to be successful in her business, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to renovate rental properties and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Elgiba

texts.es: Elgiba, de 62 años, es una mujer amable y muy entusiasta, es soltera y tienes 6 hijos mayores de edad, actualmente vive en su casa propia solo con su ultima hija y su pequeño nieto. El trabajo de Elgiba consiste en la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, agua y cerveza. Distribuye diariamente sus productos entre sus vecinos y ocasionales clientes. Compra las bebidas directamente de la empresa productora de manera consecutiva. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 20 años y le va muy bien. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hija. Ocasionalmente complemente este negocio con la venta de comida. Le gusta mucho trabajar de esta manera ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo libre y dedicárselo a su nieto, quiere mucho a su familia y desea brindarles lo mejor cada día es por eso que su meta es consolidar un bar –restaurante para que continúe trabajando. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente más gaseosas, cervezas y aguas envasadas para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Egilba, 62 years old, is a kind and enthusiastic woman. She is single and has 6 children, all of them now adults. She lives in her own house together with her youngest daughter and a small grandson.

Elgiba works selling cold drinks, such as soft drinks, water and beer. She distributes her products every day among neighbours and occasional customers. She continuously buys the beverages directly from the producing company. She has been doing this work for 20 years and has done well with it, working together with her daughter. She occasionally supplements this work with the sale of food. She enjoys working like this very much since it allows her to have free time, which she can then spend with her grandson. She loves her family very much and wishes to provide them the best every day, so her goal is to have a restaurant-bar where she can continue working.

This time Elgiba is requesting 3800 nuevos soles. She is very happy to know that she will have the economic support to keep advancing towards the fulfilment of her goals. With the amount requested she will buy an increasing number of soft drinks, beers and water bottles, which she will use to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es una mujer de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Delfina no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Delfina trabaja vendiendo desayunos, ella tiene un pequeño carrito sanguchero acondicionado donde brinda sus servicios, Delfina trabaja todos días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas.
Delfina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mantenimiento de su carrito sanguchero y comprara sillas para atender a sus clientes, así pues Delfina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Delfina is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her husband and 2 children. She is very hard-working and enthusiastic. She and her husband put all their efforts into getting their family ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Delfina was not able to go to college.

By her own initiative, Delfina works selling breakfasts. She has a small sandwich cart from where she sells her products. Delfina works every day from early in the morning and for approximately 8 hours.

Delfina is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to maintain her sandwich cart and buy chairs for her customers. Delfina will thus keep working and making an effort to achieve her goal to have her own house.

loans.use: to maintain her sandwich cart

loans.name: Djulita

texts.en:
Djulita made her family proud by graduating with a diploma in management studies.  She wants to be an entrepreneur as she believes it allows her more creativity and time than working in an office.  Djulita currently works as a tutor in a church-based children's center.

To improve her income, Djulita has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy clean energy stock such as solar lamps, water filters, and cooking stoves and grow her business.

Djulita sees a huge market for cook stoves and water filters.  She knows that most of the people in Kupang, the capital of East Nusa Tenggara province, are still using traditional open fires or kerosene stoves, and are drinking dirty water.  She is keen to educate her customers in the cost-savings and health benefits of these products.

loans.use: to purchase clean energy products and resell them in her community

loans.name: Angela Veronica

texts.es:
Ángela, es madre de cuatro hijos los cuales están estudiando, es soltera de 33 años de edad, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para darles a sus hijos una vida digna, ella desde hace cinco años se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, actividad que desempeña todos los días y es apoyada por sus hijos, por lo que no se hace una actividad difícil de realizar.
Invertirá en la compra de cerdos y alimento para engordarlos, con lo que su negocio será fortalecido, espera tener mayores ventas y mejores ingresos que le ayuden a ir cancelando las cuotas del préstamo.
Sueña con tener un  negocio más grande para dar a sus hijos mejora alimentación, salud y una educación superior de calidad.
texts.en:
Ángela is the mother of four children who attend school.  She is 33 years old, single, and decided to begin raising pigs five years ago, in order to generate income so that she could give her children a dignified life.  She works every day, with help from her children, so this is not a difficult task.

She will buy pigs and feed and this will strengthen her business so that she can increase her sales and improve her income.  This will help her pay off the loan.

She wants to have a larger business so she can better provide better food, health, and a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a 7000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, and noodles for her food vending business. She has been in this business for 12 years.

Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, and noodles for her food vending business

loans.name: Elitza Haydee

texts.es:
Elitza tiene 28 años de edad vive junto a sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima cálido lo que le ha permitido cultivar diversos frutales mangos, ciruela, manzana entre otros,, la población se dedica l comercio y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad e Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y comida desde hace cinco años, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio cuenta con cliente la considerable, pues la reconocen por el buen sabor de sus platos que ofrece, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida que ofrece, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elitza is 28 years old and lives together with her children and husband in the district of La Matanza, a community that is known for its warm climate, which makes it possible to cultivate diverse fruits like mangos, plums, apples, and other fruits.  The population in the area works in commerce and agriculture. They are located about two hours from the city of Piura, on the Northern coast of Perú.   

Elitza works selling food and beer and has been working in this field for five years.  Her business is located in her home and she counts on a considerable customer base.  She is known for the good flavor of the dishes she offers.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman.  She is asking for a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency) in order to buy products for the making of the meals that she offers, which will help her generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy products for making meals.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Since 2007, Enkhbold has been transporting passengers and delivering goods between provinces. Using his previous loan, he bought a truck and used it for coal transport, increasing his income. 

Now, he is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to buy a block machine to produce blocks for sale. If his business idea becomes successful, it will greatly help his family because he is the sole income generator of his family and, recently, his wife gave birth to a son. 

Meeting the needs of five people, including himself, will be a difficult task for him, so buying a block machine from China, at half-price, during a discount period, is very important to him. 

Enkhbold is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a block machine to make concrete blocks for sale.

loans.name: Sarah Mae

texts.en:
Sarah Mae has a live-in partner with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sarah Mae is 25 years old and has one child who is in school.

Sarah Mae has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell.

Sarah Mae has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставила Точинисо быть в поиске нового источника дохода. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж занимается собственным бизнесом, но последнее время его бизнес не приносит ожидаемого дохода. Этот доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Точинисо решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hardships in life have compelled Tojiniso to search for a new source of income. She is married and is raising four children; her husband runs his own business, but lately his income has been lower than expected. This income is not enough to provide for the family. Tojiniso decided to help her husband for the good of the family. With this goal in mind, she enrolled in a course titled "Achieve Success", organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and received a certificate. Now, Tojiniso is able to start a business and become successful in this area. 

Tojiniso would like to start a business sewing women's clothing, since she has experience in this type of service. Using her new income, she plans to secure good quality education and nutritious food for her children. Tojiniso is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni to buy a sewing machine and start her business; she is grateful for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and start a new business

loans.name: Charmen

texts.en:
Charmen is 33 years old  with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Charmen has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Charmen aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jeanne works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising ducks. Jeanne is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to pay for the unhulled rice and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill for her rice retailing business.

Jeanne has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for unhulled rice and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

Editha has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.  Marilyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.  Marilyn has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with seven children. She is a very hard -working entrepreneur. Teresita is 59 years old and has one child who is in school.

Teresita has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, eggs, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, eggs, etc

loans.name: Ma. Lieza

texts.en:
Ma. Lieza is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Ma. Lieza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Lieza has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Lieza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. Alicia is married, and has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines.

Alicia requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional used clothes to sell.  Alicia has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos, necesita capital para invertirlo en la reparación de su camión de carga, cambiara el sistema de frenos y hará cambio de llantas, con el cual genera los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y podrá seguir trabajando.
Con el crédito anterior su  beneficio fue mantenerse trabajando realizando viajes en su camión de carga, con lo que tuvo mejores ganancias, cancelo sus cuotas y ofrece a su familia mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Santos is asking for a loan to invest in repairs for his cargo truck. He plans to change the truck's brakes and tires, which will allow him to operate his business safely and earn the necessary income to sustain his home's expenses. 

With his previous loan, Santos also invested in his truck which allowed him to continue running his business. He was able to improve his income, pay off his debt, and offer his family better food, health, and clothing.

loans.use: to change the brakes and tires on his truck

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 49 years old, a married woman and mother of eight children. Two family members are drivers by trade and provide transportation services by using  the same three-wheeled rickshaw. Her husband drives their auto rickshaw in the daytime and her son drives it at night. They have been continuously driving a single rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for the maintenance of their rickshaw. Her husband wants to buy new tires and do little bit of engine maintenance for the vehicle. This will help them drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to their passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes to their business.

Parveen thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tires and do maintenance on their auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: julio vive con su esposa en casa propia, el posee un taller de enderezado y pintura desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y los buenos precios con lo que obtiene de sus ganancia logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Julio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura y demás materiales para el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y poder tener junto con su esposa y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio lives with his wife in their own house. For several years, he has owned an auto body and paint shop that he runs out of his home. He has many customers because of his good work. His good prices allow him to make enough income to cover some of his living expenses. Julio is applying for a loan to buy paint and other materials for his business in order to make more profits, carry on with his wife, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paint and other materials

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
Bader is a 24-year-old young man. For the past year, Bader has been operating a vehicle repair workshop, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover his cost of living.

Bader is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new vehicle repair kit. This will improve Bader's work quality and increase the demand from his customers to repair their vehicles. This will increase his income and offer him better living conditions. Bader is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle repair kit.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reyna de 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo que se dedica a trabajar. Reina posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en un  mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, posee varios clientes fijos que la prefieren por los buenos precios de sus productos, Reina solicita un préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, y así poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina, 56, lives with her husband and one child, who is working.  Reina has a business selling fruits and vegetables which is located in a market close to her house.  She has a number of regular customers who prefer her business because of the good prices she has on her products.  Reina is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.  This way she can obtain greater earnings so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven madre de 21 año de edad, su pequeño tiene 6 años y para Rosa es su mayor fuente de inspiración y lucha constante ya que quiere darle una vida digna, Rosa trabaja cada día como obrera de un fundo agrícola con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Rosa está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han dado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en vivienda donde habita ya que se encuentra en mal estado y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” poder tener su casa propia y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 21-year-old young mother. Her little one is 6 years old and he is Rosa's primary source of inspiration and she fights constantly because she wants to give him a dignified life. Rosa works everyday as a laborer on a farm estate through which she earns income to get ahead.

Rosa is grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the support they provide she will be able to purchase construction materials to complete improvements to her home where she lives which is in a poor state and she will be able to continue fighting to achieve her greatest dream: "to have her own home and to provide a career path for her son."

loans.use: to purchase materials for construction.

loans.name: Melekuini

texts.en:
Melekuini is 38 years old and married with two children.  She has a small garden where she grows taro plants and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

 Melekuini needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, a wheelbarrow, taro roots to plant, fertilizer and chemicals. 
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Melekuini will use the profits from her sales to help improve her family's living.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, a wheelbarrow, taro roots to plant, fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Sunema

texts.en:
Sunema is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Sunema has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a tarpaulin, bush knives, barbed wire and a backpack sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Sunema hopes to save more money in her account for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a tarpaulin, bush knives, barbed wire and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход молодой 27-летний предприниматель. Два года тому назад он брал кредит для расширения бизнеса, закупа арбуз и дынь. Он выражает благодарность кредиторам KIVA за то, что они профинансировали его предыдущий заем. На сегодня Фарход продолжает заниматься продажей продуктов питания в своем магазине. Его бизнес продвигается уже около 9 лет. Сейчас Фарход снова обратился за новым кредитом. Он хочет купить на сумму кредита витринный холодильник и кондиционер с функцией зима-лето для своего магазина. Так как его бизнес расширяется, ассортимент продуктов питания тоже увеличивается в его магазине. Для хранения скоропортящихся продуктов Фарходу не хватает еще одного большого витринного холодильника. К тому же он хочет создать условия в своем магазине, чтобы зимой было тепло и уютно, а летом прохладно ему необходимо установить кондиционер в помещении магазина. Для реализации своих целей он просит кредит. Фарход ценит свою предпринимательскую деятельность и устремлен на дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Farhod is a young, 27-year-old businessman. Two years ago, he took out a loan in order to expand his business and buy watermelons and cantaloupes. He is thankful to lenders at Kiva for financing that loan. Today, Farhod is continuing to sell products at his store; his business has been making progress for nine years. 

Now Farhod is again requesting a loan. He intends to use the loan amount to buy a display refrigerator and an air conditioning system with winter/summer settings for his store. Since his business is expanding, the range of food products is also increasing; in order to store highly perishable foods, Farhod needs a second refrigerator. Additionally, he would like to make his store warm and comfortable in the winter and cool in the summer, for which he must install an air conditioning system. Farhod is requesting the loan in order to achieve these goals; he takes his entrepreneurial activities seriously and strives to further develop his business.

loans.use: To buy a display refrigerator and air conditioning system with summer/winter settings for his store

loans.name: Max

texts.es:
Max esta soltero y vive en casa de los padres en la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz,  de profesión confeccionista de edredones
 
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas en su propio domicilio, todos los dias confecciona dos edredones reune una docena hasta fin de semana y luego los entrega en una de las ferias de La Paz todos los sabados. Con esta actividad el se mantiene y cubre sus minimas necesidades, en sus ratos libres se dedica a la construccion  o refaccion de casas.

el préstamo lo requiere par la compra de telas y otros insumos para continuar con su negocio de confección de edredones que se venderán mucho en estas fiestas navideñas.
 
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Max is single and lives at home with his parents in the Alto Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz. He works making quilts.

Currently, he works more than 8 hours a day from his home. He is able to make two quilts a day which allows him to bring about a dozen with him to various fairs around La Paz each Saturday where he sells his work. He is able to support himself and cover his basic needs through his sales, and in his free time he works in construction and house repairs. 

The loan that he is asking for is to buy fabric and other items necessary for him to continue making his quilts, especially since he will sell many during the upcoming Christmas season. This is his second loan with IMPRO and his first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other items necessary to make quilts for his Christmas season sales

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima cálido, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la tiene un negocio ubicado en su domicilio donde ofrece ceviche, parihuelas, venta de cerveza y gaseosas, desde hace cinco años, junto a su esposo se han esforzado para ser reconocidos en la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza, para incrementar su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edith is 35 years old and lives together with her children and husband in the district of Pucará, which is a community characterized by a warm climate.  The population mostly works cultivating fruits, selling fruits, and raising livestock.  The town is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, off the northern coast of Perú.  

Edith works in a business that she has in her home where she offers Ceviche, seafood stew, and sells beer and soft drinks.  She has been working in this area for the past five years.  Along with her husband, they have made an effort to become recognized in the area.

She is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles in order to purchase beer, which will help her grow her business and in this way she will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase beer, in order to supply her business.

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es:
Nilton tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a sus suegros en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores pavos, patos y cerdos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nilton is 21 years old and lives with his inlaws in the district of Cayalti. This region is known for its agriculture, livestock, and commerce. It is located two hours north of the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. 

Nilton works raising and selling small animals, specifically turkeys, ducks and pigs. He raises them in his backyard. He is now asking for a loan of 1,000 Soles to buy basic feed to fatten the animals, so he can sell them for a better price. This way he will improve the income he has to support his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten his animals

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 34 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se caracteriza por la elaboración de sus dulces tradicionales a base de leche, maní e higos, celebraciones religiosas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, gallinas y cerdos, también se dedica al cultivo de frutales y venta de leche fresca y panca en el mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y una segunda parte para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 34 years old. He lives together with his wife and children in the district of Zaña, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The community is characterized by the making of traditional sweets made from milk, figs and peanuts and it's religious festivals. It's people work as farmers, engage in commerce and raise livestock.

Walter raises small animals like turkeys, chickens and pigs. He also grows fruit and sells fresh milk and maize leaves in the local market.

Walter has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy balanced feed so he can raise production to offer his clients. The second part he will use to maintain his crops, generating more revenue for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and care for his fruit crops.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Shirley is 36 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Shirley has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like hotdogs, chorizo, chicken, pork, etc. for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for two years. In the future, Shirley would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like hotdogs, chorizo, chicken, pork, etc. for her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 41 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her extended family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Annie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Annie aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Grizel

texts.en:
Grizel works hard to support her family. Grizel has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, spices, meat, etc.  Grizel has been in this business for years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, spices, meat, etc

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 56 years old and married.

Ellen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ellen has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Ellen aspires to building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn works hard to support her family. Bebelyn is married, and has a  business buying and selling mahogany seeds in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell.  Bebelyn has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is the age of 38, living with her three daughters and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a small vegetable shop for many years in a nearby town and earning a reasonable income. To grow his business he is thinking to sell fruit in the evening so that he can increase his income. With the passage of time inflation is increasing prices day by day but the sources of income remain constant. To increase income he wants to turn his enterprise towards progress. 

For the purchasing of fruit he does not have a sufficient amount; he tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives but nobody helped him. Therefore, Sumera requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy additional fruit to sell at evening.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell in the evening after his work.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 53 years old and widowed with seven children. With one child still in school, Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Veronica has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, laundry soap, bath soap, canned goods, vinegar, bread, etc. 

Veronica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano sigue viviendo en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz,  de profesión chofer.
 
Actualmente no trabaja por la mayoría de edad, pero percibe una renta de jubilacion con la cual se mantiene y cubre sus mínimas necesidades, el crédito que solicita es para refaccionar el tumbado de su vivienda ya que por la epoca de lluvias se cayo y esto hizo que se arruinaran sus muebles. Necesita comprar estuco, paja, aislante, para solucionar este problema, y hacer chequear el techo para ver si hay agujeros para taparlos.
texts.en:
Emiliano lives in his parent's house in the Achachicala region in the city of La Paz. He previously worked as a chauffeur, but is no longer working due to his advanced age. He receives social secuirity payments from the government which support his living expenses and cover his minimum needs. 

The loan that he is asking for will be used to repair the room in which he lives, as the heavy rains sustained recently have caused leaks and ruined his furniture. He needs to buy stucco, straw and insulation to solve this problem, and fix any holes that may exist.

loans.use: to by stucco, straw and insulation to repair the roof of the room in which he lives.

loans.name: Ruhiddin

texts.ru:
Рухиддин 1990 года рождения. Учится в Русско – Таджикском Славянском Университете. Он является студентом 4 курса, в факультета Международных Отношений. Рухиддин не женат, и живет с мамой. Его мать зовут Махина. Махина торгует на местном рынке.  
 Рухиддин учится хорошо,  очень положительный человек. Добропорядочный, скромный и спокойный. Довольно общительный. Несколько лет назад его отец умер. Рухиддин должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет возможности. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ruhiddin was born in 1990. He is a fourth-year student at the Russian-Tajik Slavonic University, studying International Relations. Ruhiddin is not married and is living with his mother, Mahina. Mahina sells at a local market. Ruhiddin is a good student and a very positive person. He is respectable, modest, calm, and easygoing. 

A few years ago, Ruhiddin's father passed away. Ruhiddin must pay his tuition, but is unable to do so. He is requesting a loan of $500 USD to pay for his tuition. He is grateful for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his college tuition

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: La Señora Maria sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y venta de pipocas, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar sus productos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz y bolsas para elaborar pipocas y embolsarlas para la venta y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Maria continues to make and sell popcorn. She did very well with her previous loan, which she used to buy the ingredients to make her products. She is asking for another loan to buy corn and bags so she can continue to make and distribute popcorn, thereby improving her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy corn and bags for the sale of popcorn

loans.name: Ronal Grimaldo

texts.es:
Ronal Grimaldo tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de mecánico reparando vehículos con motor, su taller esta ubicado en su domiclio, tambien ofrece servicio de manejo de maquinaria pesada, es un padre emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y accesorios para vehículos y de esta manera ofrecerlo en su taller, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ronal Grimaldo is 35 years old and lives with his son in the district of Oyotun. This community is dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and commerce, and is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo along the northern coast of Peru. 

Ronal works as a vehicle repairman, with his shop located inside his home. He also drives heavy machinary to make extra money on the side. He is very entrepreneurial and is asking for a 3,000 Soles loan to buy parts and acessories for vehicle repairs. By offering additional repair services, he will be able to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy parts for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Beysi Denis

texts.es:
Beysi Denis tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en la comunidad de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar, arroz y maíz, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público y movilidad escolar mediante su propia mototaxi, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y así poder seguir brindando este servicio de una manera segura, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Beysi Denis is 25 years old and lives with her husband in the community of Cayalti. This community is known for cultivating sugar, rice and corn, as well as raising livestock and other commercial activities. It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, along the northern coast of Peru. 

Beysi works providing transportation services for the public (and for school children) with her own mototaxi. She has asked for a 2,000 Soles loan to provide maintenance for her vehicle, in order to assure that her service is safe. This will ensure the sustainability of her business and allow her to earn greater income for her family.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y nuera en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura de arroz, caña , maíz a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros y aves de corral, también cultiva productos como hortalizas, verduras y frutas que los comercializa en los restaurants de la zona, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la compra de carneros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 58 years old and lives with his son and daughter-in-law in the district of Cayalti. This region is known for its rice, sugar, and corn. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo along the northern coast of Peru. 

Juan works raising and selling sheep and fowl, and he also grows crops such as beans, vegetables and fruit which he sells to local restaurants. He is a very hardworking man who is asking for a 1,500 Soles loan to buy animal feed and additional sheep. This will enable to him to increase his family's income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and sheep

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 42 años de edad vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, conocida por ser un distrito que celebra fiestas religiosas y elaboración de dulces típicos de la zona, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral patos, gallinas y pavos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, tiene una vaca que le permite ofrecer la leche en el mercado de la zona y ocasionalmente ofrece trabajos agrícolas.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción de animales para ofrecer a sus clientes y una segunda parte para la compra de gallinas ponedoras y construcción de corrales de las mismas y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 42 years old. She lives together with her son in the district of Zaña, a community that is in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is known for being a district that celebrates religious holidays and the creation of traditional sweets of the area. It is 2 hours north of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She is in the raising and selling of birds, barnyard ducks, hens, and turkeys for a living in the rear of her home. She has a cow that allows her to offer milk in the market in the area and occasionally offers agricultural work.

She has requested a loan of $800 from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase balanced feed and therefore have a better animal production to offer to her customers. The second part is for the purchase of laying hens and construction of pens for them to generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and laying hens.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 52 años de edad de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Chulucanas, una comunidad que se caracteriza por el comercio de artesanías, elaboración de joyas de plata, cerámicos, manualidades en base a plantas de la zona y agricultura, que pertenece a la a provincia de Morropon, ubicado en la Región Piura, cota norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas desde hace cinco años, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de vinos, champagne, sangría para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 52 years old. He lives with his parents in the district of Chulucanas, which belongs to Morropon province, in the Piura region on Peru's North Coast. This community is characterized by it's handicrafts, silver jewelry production, ceramics, craft work made from local plants and agriculture.

Segundo has sold beer and soft drinks for the last 5 years. He works from his home. He has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy wine, champagne and sangria to stock his business and generate more revenue for his family.

loans.use: to buy wine, champagne etc to stock his business.

loans.name: Mamela

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mamela works hard to support her family.  She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugar cane.  

Mamela is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture making business.  Mamela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her furniture business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vicenta is 34 years old, and has three children who are still in school.

Vicenta has a general store business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like candies, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, detergent, soap, etc. to sell.  Vicenta has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like candies, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, detergent, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She is 53 years old and works hard to support her family.  Nida has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.  She has been in this business for three years now.  In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a buy-and-sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Rolyen

texts.en:
Rolyen is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Rolyen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rolyen requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rolyen has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rolyen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Glendy

texts.es: Ana de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, semillas, etc. y poder mejorar su terreno para la siembra que ese el que muestra la fotografía  y así poder obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and three-year-old daughter.  She has been growing corn and beans for the past 10 years. With the money she earns she manages to pay some of her household expenses. 

Ana is requesting a loan so she can buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, seeds, etc. and be able to improve her land for planting, as shown in the picture. This will allow her to increase her income and have more financial stability for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control, herbicides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: 3 De Noviembre  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito 3 de Noviembre está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha belleza natural, sus grandes montañas la rodean y tiene hermoso paisajes, sus verdes campos productos de la agricultura y pastos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y moderno. Las socias son personas que aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su mayor fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, la crianza de animales y el comercio, su objetivo principal es  sacar adelante a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana Lourdes, tiene 25 años de edad,  es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad,  su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Ana Lourdes pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su familia, pero le ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes y ganado, también a la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta. 
El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cerdos y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es criar más animales para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group Third of November is composed of 7 women who live around the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca. This place boasts a lot of natural beauty with large mountains that surround it and its beautiful scenery from its green fields of agricultural products and pastures. Its architecture is a mix of antique and modern. The members are people that still maintain the culture and traditions of their hometowns. Their primary sources of income are agriculture, raising animals and commerce. Their primary goal is to get their families ahead. 

One of the members is Ana Lourdes who is 25 years old, is married and the fruit of this union is 4 children who are 13, 11, 9 and 7 years old. Her eldest daughter studies in high school and her other children are in school. Her husband works as a mason. The house that they live in is their own. Ana Lourdes spends the majority of her time at home caring for her family, but she also helps her husband cover the expenses of their home because she works raising pigs, guinea pigs and cattle. Along with farming, this is for household consumption as well as for sales. The money from her loan will be used to purchase pigs and food for her animals. Her goal is to raise more animals to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and food for animals.

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es:
Heidy esta soltera y vive en casa de los padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz;  de profesión profesora de primaria y confeccionista de Chamarras.
 
Actualmente trabaja como profesora de primaria y en sus ratos libres se dedica a la confección de chamarras en su propio domicilio lugar donde tiene un pequeño taller; confecciona a pedido pero también efectúa contratos con empresas, con esta actividad ella aumenta sus ingresos ya que el sueldo que percibe es muy poco.

El crédito lo necesita para cumplir con un contrato que obtuvo para confeccionar chamarras y necesita comprar telas, cierres, forros, hilos y otros insumos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez en KIVA.
texts.en:
Heidy is single and lives with her parents in the Tembladerani region in the city of La Paz. She is a primary school teacher who makes and sells coats in her spare time. 

Heidy has a small shop inside her home where she makes her coats. She produces these coats on demand, but also engages in contracts with businesses that want to buy from her. With this work, she supplements her teacher's salary which is very low. 

The loan that she is asking for will be used to make more coats, for which she needs to buy fabric, zippers, linings and thread among other materials. This will be her first loan with IMPRO and her first loan with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, linings and other materials to make coats

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, está casada con René y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. El trabajo de Diana consiste en la crianza de pollos y gallinas, acondicionó un espacio en la huerta de su casa en donde construyó un pequeño galpón, lleva 5 años cumpliendo esta labor y ha ido aprendiendo a desarrollar mejor esta función con el paso del tiempo. Realiza sus ventas por campañas cuando completa cierta cantidad de gallinas o cuando sus animales han alcanzado el peso ideal. Trabaja siempre sola mientras su pareja cumple con otro rol laboral. También ocupa su tiempo a la venta por productos por catálogos  como zapatos, perfumes, entre otros. Le gusta realizar su trabajo ya que le permite cumplir otras funciones en su hogar como atender a sus hijos o a su cónyuge, siempre tiene el tiempo suficiente para cumplir su labor de madre, gracias a este trabajo su situación financiera es estable y sostenible, se encuentra muy optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado comprará pollos bebes, vitaminas y alimentos balanceados.
texts.en:
Diana, 30 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman. She is married to René and together they have two children who are 7 and 3 years old. Diana works raising chickens and hens, in a small pen she has fashioned in her yard. She has been doing this for 5 years and business keeps getting better with time. She will sell her chickens in waves when she has raised a certain number or when the animals have reached their ideal weight. She always works alone while her husband is off doing his own work. In addition to animal sales, she also sells catalog products such as shoes and perfumes among other items. She likes her work as it allows her to complete tasks around the home, such as taking care of her children and husband. She always has time to complete her work as a mother, and thanks to her work she has a stable and sustainable financial situation. Diana is a very optimistic person with a great desire to continue to get ahead. 

At this time, Diana is asking for a loan of 3,800 Soles. With this loan she will purchase baby chickens, vitamins and animal feed. She is very happy to know that the economic support she receives will allow her to continue to reach her goals. She promises to be punctual with her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy baby chickens, vitamins, and animal feed

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesús María tiene 39 años de edad, vive en su propia casa en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de plásticos, cuenta con clientela considerable, tiene pedidos quincenales, también brinda servicios de fotocopia, su negocio se encuentra en la parte céntrica de Buenos Aires teniendo una ubicación comercial que le favorece.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para abastecer su negocio con la compra de plásticos, depósitos, y utensilios y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús María is 39 years old and lives in her own home in the district of Buenos Aires, whose inhabitants work in farming, commerce, and livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Piura on Peru's northern coast. 

She sells plastic containers for a living.  She has a considerable clientele and has biweekly orders.  She also offers photocopying services.  Her business is in the central part of Buenos Aires, which is a business location that works in her favor.  

She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to stock her business by buying plastic containers, buckets, and appliances so she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy buckets, plastic containers, and kitchen appliances

loans.name: Kogesenda Group

texts.en:
Kogesenda is a group of farmers in Kuria West district in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group the members collectively guarantee the loan.

David, raising his hand in the picture, is a member of the Kogesenda Group of Nuru farmers. He is 48 years old with seven children, four of whom attend school. He has been a Nuru farmer for three years. The loan from Kiva will enable David and other members of his group purchase farm inputs that include hybrid seeds and fertilizers. Just like other members of his group, he will grow one-half acre of maize and one-quarter acre each for millet and sorghum for the 2014 long rains. With the hybrid seeds, fertilizers, and extension services, David is optimistic for a good harvest. This harvest will ensure food security in his household and he will sell the surplus and use the money to pay school fees for his four children who go to school.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka with his three siblings and his parents. 

Basel is studying in his second year for his diploma in marketing. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But, he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Yong is 44 years old. She is married and resides with her five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Four of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $16 each day. Due to the family's difficulties with transportation, Yong is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her children easily commute to work. In the future, she would like to purchase a store where her children can run a tailoring shop and help her children earn a higher education. In addition, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nuestros Lirios De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal nuestros lirios de los valles está conformado por doce integrantes madres solteras con veinte hijos. Son originarias de la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.
